See also {stela}.

ckilu.definition: x_1 (si'o) is a scale of units for measuring/observing/determining x_2 (state).

ckini.definition: x_1 is related to/associated with/akin to x_2 by relationship x_3.

ckire.definition: x_1 is grateful/thankful to/appreciative of x_2 for x_3 (event/property).

ckule.definition: x_1 is school/institute/academy at x_2 teaching subject(s) x_3 to audien./commun. x_4 operated by x_5.

ckunu.definition: x_1 is a conifer/pine/fir of species/strain x_2 with cones x_3.

cladu.definition: x_1 is loud/noisy at observation point x_2 by standard x_3.

clani.definition: x_1 is long in dimension/direction x_2 (default longest dimension) by measurement standard x_3.

claxu.definition: x_1 is without/lacking/free of/lacks x_2; x_1 is x_2-less.

clika.definition: x_1 is a moss/lichen of species/strain x_2 growing on x_3; (adjective:) x_1 is mossy.

clira.definition: x_1 (event) is early by standard x_2.

clite.definition: x_1 is polite/courteous/civil in matter x_2 according to standard/custom x_3.

cliva.definition: x_1 leaves/goes away/departs/parts/separates from x_2 via route x_3.
cliva.note: Also: x_1 leaves behind/takes leave of x_2.  See also {litru}, {canci}, {vimcu}, {lebna}, {muvdu}.

clupa.definition: x_1 is a loop/circuit of x_2 [material].
clupa.note: Also noose (= {skoclupa}, {saljgeclupa}; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by set of points (= {cuptai}).  See also {djine}.

cmaci.definition: x_1 is a mathematics of type/describing x_2.

cmalu.definition: x_1 is small in property/dimension(s) x_2 (ka) as compared with standard/norm x_3.

cmana.definition: x_1 is a mountain/hill/mound/[rise]/[peak]/[summit]/[highlands] projecting from land mass x_2.

cmavo.definition: x_1 is a structure word of grammatical class x_2, with meaning/function x_3 in usage (language) x_4.
cmavo.note: x_4 may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; x_3 and x_4 may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) {ma'oste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = {ma'orpoi}, {ma'orselcmi}, {ma'orselste}).  See also {gismu}, {lujvo}, {gerna}, {smuni}, {valsi}.

cmene.definition: x_1 (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of x_2 to/used-by namer/name-user x_3 (person).
cmene.note: Also: x_2 is called x_1 by x_3 (= selcme for reordered places).  See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}. Historically used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use with proper nouns; this sense has been deprecated in favor of {cmevla}.

cmila.note: x_1 laughs at x_2 (= {mi'afra}).  See also {ckasu}, {frumu}, {xajmi}, {cisma}.

cmima.definition: x_1 is a member/element of set x_2; x_1 belongs to group x_2; x_1 is amid/among/amongst group x_2.
cmima.note: x_1 may be a complete or incomplete list of members; x_2 is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership.  See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

cmoni.definition: x_1 utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] x_2 expressing x_3 (property).
cmoni.note: Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}.

cnano.definition: x_1 [value] is a norm/average in property/amount x_2 (ka/ni) among x_3(s) (set) by standard x_4.
cnano.note: Also mean, normal, usual; (x_3 specifies the complete set).  See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

cnebo.definition: x_1 is a/the neck [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point].

cnemu.definition: x_1 (agent) rewards x_2 [recipient] for atypical x_3 (event/property) with reward/desserts x_4.
cnemu.note: Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); x_4 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, {posyvelne'u} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.

cnici.definition: x_1 is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity x_2 (ka/ni).

cnino.definition: x_1 is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer x_2 in feature x_3 (ka) by standard x_4; x_1 is a novelty.

cnisa.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].

cnita.definition: x_1 is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from x_2 in frame of reference x_3.

cokcu.definition: x_1 soaks up/absorbs/sucks up x_2 from x_3 into x_4; x_1 is an absorbant.

condi.definition: x_1 is deep in extent in direction/property x_2 away from reference point x_3 by standard x_4.

cortu.definition: x_1 hurts/feels pain/hurt at locus x_2.

cpacu.definition: x_1 gets/procures/acquires/obtains/accepts x_2 from source x_3 [previous possessor not implied].
cpacu.note: Also fetch; accept a gift (= {seldu'acpa}).  See also {punji}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

cpana.definition: x_1 is upon/atop/resting on/lying on [the upper surface of] x_2 in frame of reference/gravity x_3.
cpana.note: (x_1 may be object or event); See also se {vasru}, {jbini}, {zvati}, {nenri}, {vreta}, {ckana}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {zutse}, {punji} for lay upon, {sarji}, {zbepi}.

cpare.definition: x_1 climbs/clambers/creeps/crawls on surface x_2 in direction x_3 using x_4 [limbs/tools].

cpedu.definition: x_1 requests/asks/petitions/solicits for x_2 of/from x_3 in manner/form x_4.
cpedu.note: Also demand (= {mi'ecpe}); x_4 is a means of expression See also ve {cusku}.: a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor).  (cf. {pikci}, te {preti}, te {frati}, se {spuda}, {danfu})

cpina.definition: x_1 is pungent/piquant/peppery/spicy/irritating to sense x_2.

cradi.definition: x_1 broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] x_2 via station/frequency x_3 to [radio] receiver x_4.
cradi.note: Also x_1 is a broadcaster.  See also {tivni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

crane.definition: x_1 is anterior/ahead/forward/(in/on) the front of x_2 which faces/in-frame-of-reference x_3.
crane.note: Also: x_3 is the standard of orientation for x_2. See also {sefta}, {flira}, {trixe}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

creka.definition: x_1 is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material x_2.

crepu.definition: x_1 (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects x_2 from source/area x_3.

cribe.definition: x_1 is a bear/ursoid of species/breed x_2.

crida.definition: x_1 is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion x_2.
crida.note: Also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman.  (cf. {ranmi}, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, {lijda})

cripu.definition: x_1 is a bridge/span over/across x_2 between x_3 and x_4 [unordered, typically destination first].

crisa.definition: x_1 is summer/summertime [hot season] of year x_2 at location x_3.

critu.definition: x_1 is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year x_2 at location x_3.

ctaru.definition: x_1 is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in x_2 caused by x_3.

ctebi.definition: x_1 is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice x_2 of body x_3; (adjective:) x_1 is labial.

cteki.definition: x_1 is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event x_2 levied against x_3 by authority/collector x_4.
cteki.note: Also custom, toll, tariff, tribute. See also {pleji}, {flalu}, {turni}.

ctile.definition: x_1 is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source x_2.

ctino.definition: x_1 is a shadow/the shade of object x_2, made by light/energy source x_3.

ctuca.definition: x_1 teaches audience x_2 ideas/methods/lore x_3 (du'u) about subject(s) x_4 by method x_5 (event).
ctuca.note: Also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) x_1/x_5 is pedagogical.  See also {ckule}, {cilre}, {tadni}.

cukla.definition: x_1 is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; x_1 is a disk/circle/ring.
cukla.note: Normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring'.  See also {djine}, {ranji}, {bolci}, {tarmi}.

cukta.definition: x_1 is a book containing work x_2 by author x_3 for audience x_4 preserved in medium x_5.
cukta.note: [x_1 is a manifestation/container A physical object or its analogue. of a work/content, not necessarily using paper (= {selpapri})]; See also {cfika}, {prina}, {prosa}, {tcidu}, {papri}.

culno.definition: x_1 is full/completely filled with x_2.

cumki.definition: x_1 (event/state/property) is possible under conditions x_2; x_1 may/might occur; x_1 is a maybe.

cumla.definition: x_1 is humble/modest about x_2 (abstraction); x_1 displays humility about x_2.

cunmi.definition: x_1 is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain x_2.

cunso.definition: x_1 is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions x_2, with probability distribution x_3.
cunso.note: Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = {cuncu'a}, {cunselcu'a}, {cunjdi}, {cunseljdi}; based on "unpredictable").  See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

cuntu.definition: x_1 is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) x_2 (ind./mass); x_1 is x_2's business.
cuntu.note: Also matter, concern; x_2 is engaged in x_1 (which is usually an abstraction) (= {selcu'u} for reordered places). See also {jikca}, {srana}.

cupra.definition: x_1 produces x_2 [product] by process x_3.

curmi.definition: x_1 (agent) lets/permits/allows x_2 (event) under conditions x_3; x_1 grants privilege x_2.
curmi.note: Sufficient condition (= {crutcini}), agent that permits a situation (= {tcinycru}).  See also {rinju}, {banzu}, {ralte}, {jimte}, {jaspu}, {zifre}.

curnu.definition: x_1 is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed x_2.
curnu.note: Also mollusk, snail (= {cakcurnu}), shellfish (= {xaskemcakcurnu}, {xaskemcakydja}); the generalization to invertebrate is because many multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike.  See also {since}, {silka}.

curve.definition: x_1 is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property x_2 (ka).
curve.note: x_1 is simply/purely/unmitigatedly/solely x_2.  See also {prane}, {jinsa}, {manfo}, {sampu}, {sepli}, {traji}, {lumci}, {xukmi}.

cusku.definition: x_1 (agent) expresses/says x_2 (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience x_3 via expressive medium x_4.
cusku.note: Also says.  See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

cutci.definition: x_1 is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] x_2, and of material x_3.

cutne.definition: x_1 is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of x_2.

cuxna.definition: x_1 chooses/selects x_2 [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives x_3 (complete set).

dacru.definition: x_1 is a drawer/file in structure x_2, a [sliding compartment] container for contents x_3.

dacti.definition: x_1 is a material object enduring in space-time; x_1 is a thing.

dadjo.definition: x_1 pertains to the Taoist culture/ethos/religion in aspect x_2.

dakfu.definition: x_1 is a knife (tool) for cutting x_2, with blade of material x_3.

dakli.definition: x_1 is a sack/bag with contents x_2, and of material x_3.

damba.definition: x_1 fights/combats/struggles with x_2 over issue x_3 (abstract); x_1 is a fighter/combatant.
damba.note: Use x_3 tu'a for fight over an object/objective.  See also {bradi}, {gunta}, {talsa}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {jamna}, {sonci}.

damri.definition: x_1 is a drum/cymbal/gong [percussion musical instrument] with beater/actuator x_2.

dandu.definition: x_1 hangs/dangles/is suspended from x_2 by/at/with joint x_3.
dandu.note: Pendant (= {dadja'i}); also dependent (original meaning). See also {lasna}, {jorne}.

danfu.definition: x_1 is the answer/response/solution/[reply] to question/problem x_2.

danlu.definition: x_1 is an animal/creature of species x_2; x_1 is biologically animate.

danmo.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of smoke/smog/air pollution from source x_2.
danmo.note: x_2 may be a fire.  See also {pulce}, {gapci}, {sigja}, {bumru}.

danre.definition: x_1 (force) puts pressure on/presses/applies force to x_2.

dansu.definition: x_1 (individual, mass) dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm x_2.

danti.definition: x_1 is a ballistic projectile [e.g. bullet/missile] for firing by [gun/propelling launcher] x_2.
danti.note: Also cannonball, catapult stone, shot pellet(s).  See also {cecla}, {renro}, {jakne}.

daplu.definition: x_1 is an island/atoll/key of [material/properties] x_2 in surroundings/body x_3; x_1 is insular.

dapma.definition: x_1 curses/damns/condemns x_2 to fate (event) x_3.
dapma.note: Curse with a specific expression (= {dapsku}).  See also {mabla}, {dimna}, {cnemu}, {sfasa}, {dunda}, {cusku}, {cirko}, {jdima}, {di'ai}.

dargu.definition: x_1 is a road/highway to x_2 from x_3 with route x_4 (x_2/x_3 may be unordered).
dargu.note: A regularly used, improved-for-use surface for travelling.  See also {naxle}, {tcana}, {pluta}, {klaji}.

darlu.definition: x_1 argues for stand x_2 against stand x_3; [an opponent is not necessary].

darno.definition: x_1 is far/distant from x_2 in property x_3 (ka).

darsi.definition: x_1 shows audacity/chutzpah in behavior x_2 (event/activity); x_1 dares to do/be x_2 (event/ka).

darxi.definition: x_1 hits/strikes/[beats] x_2 with instrument [or body-part] x_3 at locus x_4.

daski.definition: x_1 is a pocket/pouch of/in garment/item x_2.

dasni.definition: x_1 wears/is robed/garbed in x_2 as a garment of type x_3.
dasni.note: x_2 need not be intended for use as a garment (unlike taxfu).  See also {taxfu}.

daspo.definition: x_1 (event) destroys/ruins/wrecks/despoils x_2; x_1 is destructive.

dasri.definition: x_1 is a ribbon/tape/strip/band/stripe of material x_2.

datka.definition: x_1 is a duck/[drake] of species/breed x_2.

datni.definition: x_1 (du'u) [fact/measurement] is data/information/statistic(s) about x_2 gathered by method x_3.
datni.note: Evidence (= velji'i datni or just {velji'i}, {sidydatni}). See also {fatci}, {saske}, {vreji}.

decti.definition: x_1 is a tenth [1/10; 10^{-1}] of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).
decti.note: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

degji.definition: x_1 is a/the finger/digit/toe [body-part] on limb/body site x_2 of body x_3; [metaphor: peninsula].

dejni.definition: x_1 owes x_2 in debt/obligation to creditor x_3 in return for x_4 [service, loan]; x_1 is a debtor.

dekpu.definition: x_1 is x_2 (default 1) local volume unit(s) [non-metric; e.g. bushel], standard x_3, x_4 subunits.
dekpu.note: Gallon (= {likydekpu}), quart (= {likseldekpu}), barrel (wet = likybradekpu, dry = sudbradekpu), bushel (= {sudydekpu}), peck (= {sudyseldekpu}), cupful (= {kabrydekpu}), tablespoon (= {mucydekpu}); teaspoon (= {mucyxeldekpu}); (all of these lujvo may need gic- to distinguish the English measurement system in contrasting with some local system; the English system is otherwise presumed to be the default non-metric system).  (additional subunit places may be added as x_5, x_6, ...); See also {canlu}, {litce}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

dekto.definition: x_1 is ten [10; 10^1] of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

delno.definition: x_1 is x_2 candela [metric unit] in luminosity (default is 1) by standard x_3.

dembi.definition: x_1 is a bean/pea/leguminous seed from plant [legume] x_2.

denci.definition: x_1 is a/the tooth [body-part] of x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is dental.

denmi.definition: x_1 is dense/concentrated/packed/intense in property x_2 (ka) at location/locus x_3.

denpa.definition: x_1 awaits/waits/pauses for/until x_2 at state x_3 before starting/continuing x_4 (activity/process).
denpa.note: (x_2 is an event, usually a point event); also: resuming x_4.  See also {dicra}, {fanmo}, {sisti}, {fliba}, {pandi}.

dertu.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of dirt/soil/earth/ground from source x_2 of composition x_3.
dertu.note: Also: x_1 is earthen; x_3: composition including x_3, which need not be exhaustive of composition.  See also {kliti}, {terdi}, {loldi}.

derxi.definition: x_1 is a heap/pile/stack/mound/hill of materials x_2 at location x_3.

desku.note: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and fro, back and forth, reciprocal motion.  See also {slilu}, {janbe}.

detri.definition: x_1 is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state x_2, at location x_3, by calendar x_4.
detri.note: (time units in x_1 are specified as numbers separated by pi'e or are unit values massified with joi); See also cmavo list {de'i}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {tcika}.

dicra.definition: x_1 (event) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] x_2 (object/event/process) due to quality x_3.

dikca.definition: x_1 is electricity [electric charge or current] in/on x_2 of polarity/quantity x_3 (def. negative).
dikca.note: (x_3, a quantifier, can be expressed as a simple polarity using the numerals for positive and negative ma'u and ni'u); (explicitly) negative (= {dutydikca}), positive (= {mardikca}); current (= {selmuvdikca}, {muvdikca}; again default negative/electron current), charge (= {klodikca}, {stadikca}).  See also {lindi}, {xampo}, {flecu}, {maksi}, {tcana}.

diklo.definition: x_1 is local to x_2; x_1 is confined to locus x_2 within range x_3; x_1 is regional
diklo.note: Indicates a specific location/value within a range; e.g. a hits b.  What is the locality on b that a hits?  Thus x_1 is associated with a specific narrow region/interval x_2 of wider space/range x_3.  See also cmavo list {di'o}, {jibni}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {nenri}, {lamji}, {stuzi}, {tcila}.

dikni.definition: x_1 is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity x_2 with period/interval x_3.

dilcu.definition: x_1 is a quotient of 'x_2/x_3' [dividend x_2 divided by divisor x_3], leaving remainder x_4.

dilnu.definition: x_1 is a cloud/mass of clouds of material x_2 in air mass x_3 at floor/base elevation x_4.

dimna.definition: x_1 is a fate/destiny of x_2; [doom, curse are mabla-forms]; x_2 is fated/predestined/doomed to x_1.

dinju.definition: x_1 is a building/edifice for purpose x_2.

dinko.definition: x_1 is a nail/tack [pointed driven/frictional fastener] of type/size x_2 (ka), made of material x_3.
dinko.note: (x_2 also can be ni abstraction); See also {pijne}, {lasna}.

dirba.definition: x_1 is dear/precious/darling to x_2; x_1 is emotionally valued by x_2.
dirba.note: x_1 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydirba} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {tcika}, {kargu}, {vamji}, {vajni}, {pleji}, {jadni}, {jemna}.

dirce.definition: x_1 radiates/emits x_2 under conditions x_3.

dirgo.definition: x_1 is a drop [small, cohesive shape] of material [liquid/vapor] x_2 in surrounding material x_3.

dizlo.definition: x_1 is low/down/downward in frame of reference x_2 as compared with baseline/standard height x_3.
dizlo.note: Also lower; x_3 is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {cnita}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {farna}, {loldi}.

djacu.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of water; (adjective:) x_1 is aqueous/[aquatic].

djedi.definition: x_1 is x_2 full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard x_3; (adjective:) x_1 is diurnal.

djica.definition: x_1 desires/wants/wishes x_2 (event/state) for purpose x_3.
djica.note: If desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in x_2 (or use lujvo = {po'edji}).  See also {taske}, {xagji}, {mukti}, {nitcu}, {nelci}, {pacna}, {prami}, {rigni}, {trina}, {xebni}, {xlura}.

djine.definition: x_1 is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material x_2, inside diam. x_3, outside diam. x_4.
djine.note: Also ellipse, oval (= {jincla}); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops).  Also band, belt, encircle (= {jinsru}).  See also {clupa}, {cukla}, {dasri}, {karli}, {sovda}, {sruri}, {konju}.

djuno.definition: x_1 knows fact(s) x_2 (du'u) about subject x_3 by epistemology x_4.
djuno.note: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= {tadjyju'o}). 'know/familiar with' - {se} {slabu}, {na'e} {cnino}, {na'e} {fange}. See also {du'o}, {krici}, {jinvi}, {cilre}, {certu}, {facki}, {jijnu}, {jimpe}, {senpi}, {smadi}, {kakne}, {birti}, {mipri}, {morji}, {saske}, {viska}.

donri.definition: x_1 is the daytime of day x_2 at location x_3; (adjective:) x_1 is diurnal (vs. nocturnal).

dotco.definition: x_1 reflects German/Germanic culture/nationality/language in aspect x_2.

draci.definition: x_1 is a drama/play about x_2 [plot/theme/subject] by dramatist x_3 for audience x_4 with actors x_5.
draci.note: x_2 may also be a convention. See also {finti}, {cukta}, {lisri}, {cfika}.

drani.definition: x_1 is correct/proper/right/perfect in property/aspect x_2 (ka) in situation x_3 by standard x_4.

drata.definition: x_1 isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than x_2 by standard x_3; x_1 is something else.

drudi.definition: x_1 is a roof/top/ceiling/lid of x_2.
drudi.note: (cf. bitmu, stedu, galtu, gapru, loldi, marbi, gacri, mapku; a drudi is (designed to be) over/above something and shelters it from other things above the drudi, mapku)

dugri.definition: x_1 is the logarithm of x_2 with base x_3.

dukse.definition: x_1 is an excess of/too much of x_2 by standard x_3.

dukti.definition: x_1 is polar opposite from/contrary to x_2 in property/on scale x_3 (property/si'o).

dunda.definition: x_1 [donor] gives/donates gift/present x_2 to recipient/beneficiary x_3 [without payment/exchange].
dunda.note: Also grants; x_3 is a receiver (= {terdu'a} for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; x_2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydu'a}, {posyseldu'a} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {benji}, {muvdu}, {canja}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {friti}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {cnemu}, {prali}.

dunja.definition: x_1 freezes/jells/solidifies at temperature x_2 and pressure x_3.

dunku.definition: x_1 is anguished/distressed/emotionally wrought/stressed by x_2.

dunli.definition: x_1 is equal/congruent to/as much as x_2 in property/dimension/quantity x_3.
dunli.note: Same in quantity/quality (not necessarily in identity); 'analogy' may be expressed as the equivalence of two properties of similarity (ka x_1 simsa x_2) and (ka x_3 simsa x_4). See also {du'i}, {satci}, {frica}, {simsa}, {mintu}.

dunra.definition: x_1 is winter/wintertime [cold season] of year x_2 at location x_3.

dzena.definition: x_1 is an elder/ancestor of x_2 by bond/tie/degree x_3; x_1's generation precedes x_2's parents.

dzipo.definition: x_1 reflects Antarctican culture/nationality/geography in aspect x_2.

facki.definition: x_1 discovers/finds out x_2 (du'u) about subject/object x_3; x_1 finds (fi) x_3 (object).

fadni.definition: x_1 [member] is ordinary/common/typical/usual in property x_2 (ka) among members of x_3 (set).
fadni.note: Also: x_2 is a normal/common/ordinary/typical property among set x_3 (= selterfadni for reordered places); also regular, (mabla forms:) banal, trite, vulgar; (x_3 is complete set).  See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tcaci}, {cnano}.

fagri.definition: x_1 is a fire/flame in fuel x_2 burning-in/reacting-with oxidizer x_3 (default air/oxygen).

falnu.definition: x_1 is a sail for gathering propelling material x_2 on vehicle/motor x_3.

famti.definition: x_1 is an aunt/uncle of x_2 by bond/tie x_3; x_1 is an associated member of x_2's parent's generation.

fancu.definition: x_1 is a function/single-valued mapping from domain x_2 to range x_3 defined by expression/rule x_4.

fange.definition: x_1 is foreign/alien/[exotic]/unfamiliar to x_2 in property x_3 (ka).
fange.note: For the sense of alien (not from Earth), see {kesfange}. See also {cizra}, {jbena}, {ckini}.

fanmo.definition: x_1 is an end/finish/termination of thing/process x_2; [not necessarily implying completeness].
fanmo.note: x_1 is final/last/at the last; x_1 is a terminal/terminus of x_2; x_1 is the final/terminated state of terminated process x_2; x_2 terminates/ceases/stops/halts at x_1 (= {selfa'o} for reordered places).  See also {krasi}, {cfari}, {mulno}, {sisti}, {denpa}, {jipno}, {kojna}, {traji}, {krasi}.

fanri.definition: x_1 is a factory/foundry/industrial plant/mill producing x_2 from materials x_3.

fanta.definition: x_1 prevents/keeps/stops/restrains/constrains event x_2 from occurring.

fanva.definition: x_1 translates text/utterance x_2 to language x_3 from language x_4 with translation result x_5.
fanva.note: See also {cusku}, {bangu}. {traduki} is similar but has a different place structure.

fanza.note: Also: is disruptive to.  See also {fengu}, {raktu}, {dicra}, {tunta}, {zunti}, {jicla}.

fapro.definition: x_1 opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) x_2 (person/force ind./mass) about x_3 (abstract).

farlu.definition: x_1 falls/drops to x_2 from x_3 in gravity well/frame of reference x_4.
farlu.note: Note: things can fall in spin, thrust, or tide as well as gravity; (agentive "drop" = one of two lujvo: {falcru} and {falri'a}). See also {lafti}, {cpare}, {klama}, {sfubu}.

farna.definition: x_1 is the direction of x_2 (object/event) from origin/in frame of reference x_3.
farna.note: x_2 is towards x_1 from x_3 (= {selfa'a} for reordered places).  See also {zunle}, {pritu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {cnita}, {dizlo}, {berti}, {snanu}, {stuna}, {stici}, {purci}, {balvi}, {lidne}.

farvi.definition: x_1 develops/evolves towards/into x_2 from x_3 through stages x_4.

fasnu.definition: x_1 (event) is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; x_1 is an incident/happening/occurrence.

fatci.definition: x_1 (du'u) is a fact/reality/truth/actuality, in the absolute.

fatne.definition: x_1 [sequence] is in reverse order from x_2 [sequence]; x_1 (object) is inverted from x_2 (object).

fatri.definition: x_1 is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among x_2 with shares/portions x_3; (x_2/x_3 fa'u).
fatri.note: Also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= {fairgau}, {fairzu'e}). See also {fa'u}, {fendi}, {preja}, {katna}, {tcana}.

febvi.definition: x_1 boils/evaporates at temperature x_2 and pressure x_3.

femti.definition: x_1 is 10^{-15} of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

fendi.definition: x_1 (agent) divides/partitions/separates x_2 into sections/parts/ind. x_3 by method/partition x_4.

fengu.definition: x_1 is angry/mad at x_2 for x_3 (action/state/property).

fenki.definition: x_1 (action/event) is crazy/insane/mad/frantic/in a frenzy (one sense) by standard x_2.

fenso.definition: x_1 sews/stitches/sutures materials x_2 (ind./set) together with tool(s) x_3, using filament x_4.
fenso.note: (x_2 if a set must be a complete specification); See also {cilta}, {jivbu}, {jorne}, {nivji}, {pijne}, {lasna}.

fepni.definition: x_1 is measured in kopeck/cent money-subunits as x_2 [quantity], in monetary system x_3.
fepni.note: Also pfennig, paisa, sen, fen, dinar, etc.; x_1 is generally a price/cost/value.  (additional secondary, tertiary, etc. subunit places may be added as x_4, x_5, x_6, ...); See also {sicni}, {jdini}, {jdima}, {vecnu}, {rupnu}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

fepri.definition: x_1 is a/the lung [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: breathing/respiratory apparatus/bellows].
fepri.note: Also (adjective:) x_1 is pulmonary.  See also {pambe}, {vasxu}.

ferti.definition: x_1 is fertile/conducive for supporting the growth/development of x_2; x_1 is fruitful/prolific.
ferti.note: Also fecund (note that the Lojban covers both potential and actual/realized fertility).  See also {vanbi}, {sidju}, {rorci}, {farvi}, {banro}, {cange}.

festi.definition: x_1(s) is/are waste product(s) [left to waste] by x_2 (event/activity).
festi.note: Also shit, crap; agentive wasting (= {fesygau}, {fesyzu'e}).  See also {xaksu}, {kalci}, {pinca}.

fetsi.definition: x_1 is a female/doe of species x_2 evidencing feminine trait(s) x_3 (ka); x_1 is feminine.

figre.definition: x_1 is a fig [fruit/tree] of species/strain x_2.

filso.definition: x_1 reflects Palestinian culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

finpe.definition: x_1 is a fish of species x_2 [metaphorical extension to sharks, non-fish aquatic vertebrates].

finti.definition: x_1 invents/creates/composes/authors x_2 for function/purpose x_3 from existing elements/ideas x_4.
finti.note: x_1 is creative/inventive.  See also cmavo list {fi'e}, {ciska}, {pemci}, {zbasu}, {larcu}, specific works of authorship, {prosa}, {skina}.

flalu.definition: x_1 is a law specifying x_2 (state/event) for community x_3 under conditions x_4 by lawgiver(s) x_5.
flalu.note: x_1 is a legality; x_2 is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= {selfla} for reordered places).  See also {javni}, {ritli}, {zekri}, {pulji}, {tinbe}.

flani.definition: x_1 is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument].

flecu.definition: x_1 is a current/flow/river of/in x_2 flowing in direction to/towards x_3 from direction/source x_4.
flecu.note: [x_1 is a stream of x_2; x_2 is a fluid Gas or liquid. (= {selfle} for reordered places); x_1 flushes toward x_3; flush (= {caifle}, {sukfle})]; See also {rirxe}, {senta} where no directionality is implied, {rinci}, {xampo}, {dikca}, {sakci}, {gapci}, {litki}, {ciblu}.

fliba.definition: x_1 fails at doing x_2 (state/event); x_1 is a failure at its role in x_2.
fliba.note: Baffled (= {pesfli}, {jmifli}, {dafspufli}, {menfli}, among other senses); also x_2 ceases/does not complete/fails to continue due to failure on the part of x_1.  See also {cfila}, {snada}, {srera}, {troci}, {sisti}, {ranji}, {denpa}, {bebna}, {zunti}.

flira.definition: x_1 is a/the face [head/body-part] of x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is facial.

foldi.definition: x_1 is a field [shape/form] of material x_2; x_1 is a broad uniform expanse of x_2.
foldi.note: Also woods (= {ricfoi}), lawn/meadow (= {sasfoi}), brush (= {spafoi}, {cicyspafoi}).  See also {purdi}, {cange}.

fonmo.definition: x_1 is a quantity of foam/froth/suds of material x_2, with bubbles/vacuoles of material x_3.

fonxa.definition: x_1 is a telephone transceiver/modem attached to system/network x_2.

forca.definition: x_1 is a fork/fork-type tool/utensil for purpose x_2 with tines/prongs x_3 on base/support x_4.

fraso.definition: x_1 reflects French/Gallic culture/nationality/language in aspect x_2.

frati.definition: x_1 reacts/responds/answers with action x_2 to stimulus x_3 under conditions x_4; x_1 is responsive.
frati.note: x_3 stimulates x_1 into reaction x_2, x_3 stimulates reaction x_2 (= {terfra} for place reordering); attempt to stimulate, prod (= {terfratoi}, {tunterfratoi}).  See also {preti}, {danfu}, {spuda}, {cpedu}, {tarti}.

fraxu.definition: x_1 forgives x_2 for event/state/activity x_3.

frica.definition: x_1 differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike x_2 in property/dimension/quantity x_3.
frica.note: Also other-than (less common meaning).  See also {ranxi}, {drata}, {dunli}, {simsa}, {vrici}.

friko.definition: x_1 reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect x_2.

frili.definition: x_1 (action) is easy/simple/facile for x_2 (agent) under conditions x_3; x_2 does x_1 freely/easily.

frinu.definition: x_1 is a fraction, with numerator x_2, denominator x_3 (x_2/x_3).

friti.definition: x_1 offers/proffers x_2 [offering] to x_3 with conditions x_4.
friti.note: (x_4 may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); x_2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posfriti}, {posyselfriti} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}.

frumu.note: x_1 frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to x_2 (= {frufra}).  See also {cmila}, {cisma}.

fukpi.definition: x_1 is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of x_2 in form/medium x_3 made by method x_4 (event).

fulta.definition: x_1 (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) x_2; x_1 is buoyant.

funca.definition: x_1 (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of x_2; (note mabla/zabna not implied).

fusra.definition: x_1 rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent x_2; x_1 is rotten/decayed/fermented.

fuzme.definition: x_1 is responsible/accountable for x_2 (action/resulting state) to judge/authority x_3.

gacri.definition: x_1 is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering x_2.

gadri.definition: x_1 is an article/descriptor labelling description x_2 (text) in language x_3 with semantics x_4.
gadri.note: x_2 is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description ((x_1 with x_2) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu.  'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

galfi.note: Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}).  (cf. {stika} for non-resultative, {binxo} for not-necessarily causal change, {cenba} for non-resultative change; {zasni})

galtu.definition: x_1 is high/up/upward in frame of reference x_2 as compared with baseline/standard height x_3.
galtu.note: Also upper; x_3 is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.

galxe.definition: x_1 is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].

ganlo.definition: x_1 (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to x_2 by x_3 (something being blocked).
ganlo.note: As a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane. x_3 is blocked by x_1. x_2 is inaccessible. See also {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}.

ganra.definition: x_1 is broad/wide in dimension x_2 [2nd most significant dimension] by standard x_3.

ganse.definition: x_1 [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus x_2 (object/nu) by means x_3 under conditions x_4.
ganse.note: x_1 is sensitive to x_2; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates x_1 and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); x_3 sense/sensory channel.  See also {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}.

ganti.definition: x_1 is a/the testes/ovary/testicle/scrotum/balls/gonad/stamen/pistil [body-part] of x_2, gender x_3.

ganxo.definition: x_1 is a/the anus/anal orifice/asshole/arsehole [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: exit, waste exit].
ganxo.note: Also asshole/ass/arsehole; (adjective:) x_1 is anal.  See also {zargu}, {kalci}, {mabla}, {rinci}.

ganzu.definition: x_1 organizes x_2 [relative chaos] into x_3 [ordered/organized result] by system/principle(s) x_4.
ganzu.note: x_3 is also a system; x_4 could be merely a function which inherently serves to dictate the organizational structure of x_3.  See also {ciste}, {morna}, {stura}, {bilni}, {cabra}.

gapci.definition: x_1 is gaseous/fumes/a gas/vapor of material/composition including x_2, under conditions x_3.
gapci.note: x_3 includes temperature and pressure.  See also {pambe}, {vacri}, {litki}, {sligu}, {danmo}, {bumru}, {cidro}, {flecu}.

gapru.definition: x_1 is directly/vertically above/upwards-from x_2 in gravity/frame of reference x_3.

garna.definition: x_1 is a rail/railing/bar [tool] supporting/restraining x_2, of material x_3.

gasnu.definition: x_1 [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event x_2; x_1 does/brings about x_2.

gasta.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains steel of composition including x_2.

genja.definition: x_1 is a root [body-part] of plant/species x_2; [metaphor: immobile, supporting, nourishing].

gento.definition: x_1 reflects Argentinian culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

genxu.definition: x_1 is a hook/crook [shape/form] of material x_2.

gerku.definition: x_1 is a dog/canine/[bitch] of species/breed x_2.

gerna.definition: x_1 is the grammar/rules/defining form of language x_2 for structure/text x_3.

gidva.definition: x_1 (person/object/event) guides/conducts/pilots/leads x_2 (active participants) in/at x_3 (event).
gidva.note: A guiding person advises/suggests/sets an example to be followed, but does not necessarily control/direct/manage actual execution of an event; an event may serve as a guide by setting a pattern/example to be emulated.  See also {jitro}, {ralju}, {sazri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {fukpi}, {morna}.

gigdo.definition: x_1 is a billion [British milliard] [10^9] of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

ginka.definition: x_1 is a camp/encampment/temporary residence of x_2 at location x_3.

girzu.definition: x_1 is group/cluster/team showing common property (ka) x_2 due to set x_3 linked by relations x_4.
girzu.note: Also collection, team, comprised of, comprising; members x_3 (a specification of the complete membership) comprise group x_1; cluster (= {kangri}).  See also {bende}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {gunma}, {panra}, {cabra}, {cecmu}, {kansa}, {klesi}, {lanzu}, {liste}, {vrici}.

gismu.definition: x_1 is a (Lojban) root word expressing relation x_2 among argument roles x_3, with affix(es) x_4.
gismu.note: Gismu list, if physical object (= ({loi}) {gimste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new gismu to the gismu list = {gimpoi}, {gimselcmi}, {gimselste}).  See also {cmavo}, {cmene}, {lujvo}, {smuni}, {sumti}, {tanru}, {valsi}.

glare.definition: x_1 is hot/[warm] by standard x_2.

gletu.definition: x_1 copulates/fucks/mates/has coitus/sexual intercourse with x_2.
gletu.note: x_1 and x_2 are symmetrical; mounts (= {cpanygle}).  See also {cinse}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}, {mabla}, {speni}.

glico.definition: x_1 is English/pertains to English-speaking culture in aspect x_2.
glico.note: Generally assume broadest sense of 'English'; may refer to 'English', pertaining to the country/people/culture of England (normally requiring constraint = gligu'e, or simply redundancy = gligli-); British English, the norm language of the UK (= {gliglibau}).  (cf. {brito} which refers to the United Kingdom as a whole or to the British empire, {merko}, {sralo}, {kadno}, {skoto})

gluta.definition: x_1 is a mitten/glove [hand and lower arm garment] of material x_2.

gocti.definition: x_1 is 10^{-24} of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

gotro.definition: x_1 is 10^24 of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

gradu.definition: x_1 [magnitude] is a unit/degree of/on scale/reference standard x_2 (si'o) measuring property x_3.
gradu.note: Also grade, level, point; x_3 dimension.  See also {ckilu}, {kantu}, {kelvo}, {merli}, {ranti}, {selci}.

grake.definition: x_1 is x_2 gram(s) [metric unit] in mass (default is 1) by standard x_3.

grana.definition: x_1 is a rod/pole/staff/stick/cane [shape/form] of material x_2.

grasu.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains grease/fat/oil from source x_2.

greku.definition: x_1 is a frame/structure/skeleton/outline supporting/load-bearing/determining the form of x_2.

grute.definition: x_1 is a fruit [body-part] of species x_2.

gubni.definition: x_1 is public/un-hidden/open/jointly available to/owned by all among community x_2 (mass).

gugde.definition: x_1 is the country of peoples x_2 with land/territory x_3; (people/territory relationship).
gugde.note: Also sovereignty, domestic (as opposed to foreign), nation (when not referring to ethnos).  See also {turni}, {natmi}, {jecta}, {tumla}, {tutra}, {lanci}.

gundi.definition: x_1 is industry/industrial/systematic manufacturing activity producing x_2 by process/means x_3.

gunka.definition: x_1 [person] labors/works on/at x_2 [activity] with goal/objective x_3.
gunka.note: Also: x_1 is a worker/laborer.  (cf. {sazri}, {gasnu}, {se} {jibri}; {zukte} - which need not be labor; physics term 'work' = {ni} {muvyselbai}, {briju}, {jibri}, {lazni}, {selfu})

gunma.definition: x_1 is a mass/team/aggregate/whole, together composed of components x_2, considered jointly.
gunma.note: A description in x_1 indicates of mass property(ies) displayed by the mass; masses may reveal properties not found in the individual set members that are massified, which themselves are not necessarily relevant to the mass property implicit in this bridi.  See also {bende}, {girzu}, {pagbu}, cmavo list {loi}, {lei}, {lai}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {kansa}, {tinci}, {mulgunma}.

gunro.definition: x_1 rolls/trundles on/against surface x_2 rotating on axis/axle x_3; x_1 is a roller.

gunse.definition: x_1 is a goose/[gander] of species/breed x_2.

gunta.definition: x_1 (person/mass) attacks/invades/commits aggression upon victim x_2 with goal/objective x_3.

gurni.definition: x_1 is grain/[British: corn]/cereal from plant/species x_2.

guska.definition: x_1 blade/scraper/erosive scrapes/erodes/abrades x_2 from x_3.

gusni.definition: x_1 [energy] is light/illumination illuminating x_2 from light source x_3.
gusni.note: [x_3 illuminates/lights x_2 with light/illumination x_1; x_2 is lit/illuminated by illumination x_1 from source x_3 (= {selgu'i} for reordered places); light/lamp (= {tergu'i})](cf. {dirce}, {manku}, {solri}, {carmi}, {ctino}, {kantu})

gusta.definition: x_1 is a restaurant/cafe/diner serving type-of-food x_2 to audience x_3.

gutci.definition: x_1 is x_2 (default 1) short local distance unit(s) [non-metric], standard x_3, x_4 subunits.
gutci.note: Foot (= {jmagutci}); yard (= {cibjmagutci}), pace (= {tapygutci}), inch (= {degygutci}), cubit (= {birgutci}).  (additional subunit places may be added as x_5, x_6, ...); See also {mitre}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

gutra.definition: x_1 is a/the womb/uterus [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: nourishing, protective, giving birth].

guzme.definition: x_1 is a melon/squash [fruit/plant] of species/strain x_2.

jabre.definition: x_1 brakes/causes to slow motion/activity x_2 with device/mechanism/principle x_3.

jadni.definition: x_1 (object) adorns/decorates x_2; x_1 is an adornment/decoration of x_2; x_2 is fancy/decorated.

jakne.definition: x_1 is a rocket [vehicle] propelled by jet expelling x_2 carrying payload x_3.

jalge.definition: x_1 (action/event/state) is a result/outcome/conclusion of antecedent x_2 (event/state/process).
jalge.note: Also: x_2 gives rise to x_1 (= selja'e for reordered places); total (general meaning, but also = mekyja'e, pi'irja'e, sujyja'e).  See also se {mukti}, te {zukte}, se {rinka}, se {krinu}, se {nibli}, {mulno}, {sumji}, {pilji}, {mekso}, cmavo list {ja'e}, {ciksi}.

jalna.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of starch from source x_2 of composition including x_3.

jalra.definition: x_1 is a cockroach/orthopteran/termite of order/species/breed x_2.
jalra.note: Also grasshopper (= {pipyjalra});  cricket (= {sagjalra}); locust, termite (= {mantyjalra} or {mudyctijalra}).  (Orthoptera includes grasshoppers, crickets, etc; termites are a closely-related non-Orthoptera, more akin to cockroaches than to e.g. ants); See also {cinki}, {civla}, {manti}.

jamfu.definition: x_1 is a/the foot [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: lowest portion] (adjective:) x_1 is pedal.

jamna.definition: x_1 (person/mass) wars against x_2 over territory/matter x_3; x_1 is at war with x_2.

janbe.definition: x_1 is a bell/chime/[tuning fork] [tuned percussion instrument] producing sound/note x_2.
janbe.note: Also: x_1 rings/tolls (i.e. if it rings, then it is a bell); resonates (one sense, = {jabdesku}).  See also {zgike}, {tonga}, {desku}, {slilu}.

janco.definition: x_1 is a/the shoulder/hip/joint [body-part] attaching limb/extremity x_2 to body x_3.

janli.note: (also collide = {simjanli} for a collision between two moving objects); See also {darxi}.

jansu.definition: x_1 is a diplomat/consul representing polity x_2 in/at negotiation x_3 for function/purpose x_4.
jansu.note: (for) x_3 polity, (use tu'a); also ambassador (= {raljansu}, {trujansu}).  See also {jecta}, {krati}.

janta.definition: x_1 is an account/bill/invoice for goods/services x_2, billed to x_3 by x_4.

jarbu.definition: x_1 is a suburban area of city/metropolis x_2.

jarco.note: [reveal (= {tolmipygau}, {mipyja'o}, {sivja'o}); also: x_1 shows that x_2, x_1 shows off x_2; Use {arco} for displaying objects.; See also {tigni}, {cipra}, {zgana}, {jvinu}, {lanli}, {mipri}, {simlu}.

jarki.definition: x_1 is narrow in dimension x_2 [2nd most significant dimension] by standard x_3.

jaspu.definition: x_1 is a passport issued to x_2 (person) by authority x_3 allowing x_4 (activity).

jatna.definition: x_1 is captain/commander/leader/in-charge/boss of vehicle/domain x_2.

javni.definition: x_1 is a rule prescribing/mandating/requiring x_2 (event/state) within system/community x_3.
javni.note: Regulation, prescription (also x_2), principle, requirement (also x_2), prescribe, require (conditions are usually contained within x_2); x_1 is regulatory; x_2, x_3 are regulated.  See also {flalu}, {ritli}, cmavo list {ja'i}, {marde}, {tcaci}, {tinbe}, {zekri}.

jbama.definition: x_1 is a bomb/explosive device with explosive material/principle x_2.

jbari.definition: x_1 is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species x_2.

jbena.definition: x_1 is born to x_2 at time x_3 [birthday] and place x_4 [birthplace]; x_1 is native to (fo) x_4.
jbena.note: x_2 bears/gives birth to x_1; also x_3: natal day.  See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.

jbera.definition: x_1 (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes x_2 (object) from source x_3 for interval x_4.
jbera.note: Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}).  See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.

jbini.definition: x_1 is between/among set of points/bounds/limits x_2 (set)/amidst mass x_2 in property x_3 (ka).
jbini.note: x_2 (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for x_1.  See also se {vasru}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {snuji}, {senta}, {bitmu}, {jimte}, {kuspe}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {sruri}, {vanbi}, {midju}, {cmima}, {setca}.

jdari.definition: x_1 is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force x_2 under conditions x_3.

jdice.definition: x_1 (person) decides/makes decision x_2 (du'u) about matter x_3 (event/state).

jdika.definition: x_1 (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity x_2 by amount x_3.

jdima.definition: x_1 [amount] is the price of x_2 to purchaser/consumer x_3 set by vendor x_4.
jdima.note: x_2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as "value" or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace).  See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.

jdini.definition: x_1 is money/currency issued by x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.
jdini.note: currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}).  See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}.

jduli.definition: x_1 is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including x_2.

jecta.definition: x_1 is a polity/state governing territory/domain x_2; [government/territory relationship].

jeftu.definition: x_1 is x_2 weeks in duration (default is 1 week) by standard x_3.
jeftu.note: Re. x_3, a week may be more or less than seven days, classically being tied to the time between trips to the marketplace; this week (= {cabjeftu}); next week (= {bavlamjeftu}); last week (= {prulamjeftu}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {masti}, {nanca}.

jegvo.definition: x_1 pertains to the common Judeo-Christian-Moslem (Abrahamic) culture/religion/nationality in aspect x_2.

jelca.definition: x_1 burns/[ignites/is flammable/inflammable] at temperature x_2 in atmosphere x_3.
jelca.note: Default x_2/x_3 to normal temperatures in air; ignite (= {jelcfa}), flammable/inflammable (usually = {jelka'e} or {jelfrili}).  See also {fagri}, {kijno}, {sigja}, {livla}, {sacki}.

jemna.definition: x_1 is a gem/polished stone/pearl of type x_2 from gemstone/material/source x_3.
jemna.note: Also jewel (= {jmeja'i}); gemstone (= x_2, x_3, or {jmero'i}, {jmekunra}); pearl (= {selcakyjme} - a gem found inside a shell, {tercakyjme} - a gem made of shell material, {boijme} - any ball-shaped gem), mother-of-pearl (= {cakyjme}).  See also {kunra}, {rokci}, {jadni}, {dirba}, {kargu}, {krili}, {pulji}.

jendu.definition: x_1 is an axle/spindle [tool] on which x_2 rotates, of material/properties x_3.

jenmi.definition: x_1 (mass) is an army serving group/community x_2 (mass) in function x_3 (activity).

jerna.definition: x_1 (agent/person) earns/[deserves/merits] wages/salary/pay x_2 for work/service x_3 (activity).
jerna.note: Also x_2 earnings, reward (= {zanseljerna} or {nemjerna}), punishment/comeuppance (= {sfaseljerna}, {malseljerna}); x_3 behavior; job (= {terjerna}); x_2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyjerna}, {posyseljerna} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {jibri}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {canja}, {jdima}, {jinga}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {janta}, {kargu}, {vamji}.

jersi.definition: x_1 chases/pursues/(physically) follows after x_2; volition is not implied for x_1 or x_2.
jersi.note: x_1 follows after x_2.  See also {kavbu}, {rivbi}, {kalte}, {lidne}.

jerxo.definition: x_1 reflects Algerian culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

jesni.definition: x_1 is a needle [pointed shape/form, not tool] of material x_2.

jetce.definition: x_1 is a jet [expelled stream] of material x_2 expelled from x_3.

jetnu.definition: x_1 (du'u) is true/truth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics x_2.
jetnu.note: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {stace}, {jitfa}, {fatci}, {birti}, {cfika}.

jgalu.definition: x_1 is a/the claw/nail/talon [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: pointed, penetrating, physical weapon].

jganu.definition: x_1 is an angle [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex x_2 subtended by lateral [segment] x_3.
jganu.note: Also (adjective:) x_1 is angular; x_2 corner; (segment x_3 can be defined by interval).  See also {kojna}, {linji}, {konju}, {mokca}.

jgari.definition: x_1 grasps/holds/clutches/seizes/grips/[hugs] x_2 with x_3 (part of x_1) at locus x_4 (part of x_2).
jgari.note: Hug (= {birjai}, {pamjai}); handshake (= {xanjaisi'u}); hold with hands (= {xanjai}); handle (= {jaitci}).  See also {ralte}, {pencu}, {darxi}, {batke}, {rinju}.

jgena.definition: x_1 is a knot/tangle in/between x_2 (object/jo'u-objects).
jgena.note: Knot (verb = {jgegau}, {jgezu'e}, {jgeri'a}, {jgela'a}), knot: fastening between two or more cords (= {jgeterjo'e}).  See also {pluja}, {julne}, {lasna}, {skori}.

jgina.definition: x_1 is a gene of creature [or locus on creature] x_2 determining trait/process x_3.

jgira.note: An emotional combination of satisfaction and respect/esteem towards property(ies) or action(s) of person/entity that has a specific tie to emoter; self-pride (= {se'ijgi}, {tolcumla}); use x_2 tu'a for pride in non-specific actions/properties of someone.  See also {cinmo}, {cumla}, {sevzi}, {sinma}, {snada}.

jgita.definition: x_1 is guitar/violin/fiddle/harp [stringed musical instrument] with actuator/plectrum/bow x_2.
jgita.note: Also lute, viola, cello.  See also {zgike}.

jibni.definition: x_1 is near/close to/approximates x_2 in property/quantity x_3 (ka/ni).

jibri.definition: x_1 is a job/occupation/employment/vocation (a type of work regularly done for pay) of person x_2.
jibri.note: Working for another (= {selplijibri}).  See also {briju}, {gunka}, {te} {jerna} which is employment specifically for pay and not specifically for another, {te} {pilno} which is employment not necessarily for pay and not necessarily regular or lasting but for another, {se} {gasnu} and {se} {zukte} for incidental activities.

jicla.definition: x_1 (object, or event: force) stirs/mixes/[roils/agitates] fluid (gas/liquid) x_2.

jicmu.definition: x_1 is a basis/foundation/underlying or fundamental principle of x_2; x_1 is at the bottom of x_2.
jicmu.note: x_2 is founded on basis x_1 (= {selcmu} for reordered places); (adjective:) x_1 is basic/basal/fundamental); (generally events and properties will be bases for events and states, while objects may be bases/bottoms for objects).  See also cmavo list {ji'u}, {jamfu}, {zbepi}, {genja}, {krasi}.

jijnu.definition: x_1 (person) intuits x_2 (du'u) about subject x_3; [epistemology].
jijnu.note: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jimpe}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {sidbo}, {smadi}.

jikca.definition: x_1 interacts/behaves socially with x_2; x_1 socializes with/is sociable towards x_2.

jikru.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of liquor/spirits distilled from x_2.

jilka.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali/base of composition including x_2.

jilra.definition: x_1 (person) is jealous of/envies x_2 (person) about/for x_3 (property - ka).

jimca.definition: x_1 is a branch/bough/limb of x_2; x_2 forks into branches x_1; [preferred over metaphorical birka].

jimpe.definition: x_1 understands/comprehends fact/truth x_2 (du'u) about subject x_3; x_1 understands (fi) x_3.

jimte.definition: x_1 is a limit/extreme/bound/border/[confinement] of x_2 in property/domain x_3.
jimte.note: Restrain/constrain within limits (= {jitri'u}, {jitygau}, {jityzu'e}).  See also cmavo list {ji'e}, {traji}, {korbi}, {kuspe}, {rinju}, {bapli}, {curmi}, {fanta}, {jbini}.

jinci.definition: x_1 is a pair of shears/scissors for cutting x_2.

jinga.definition: x_1 (person/team) wins/gains prize x_2 from/over x_3 [competitors/losers] in competition x_4.
jinga.note: Also: x_1 is a victor; x_2 reward; x_3 competitors here are opponents and in many situations, defeated/losers, vs. the set of those competing for a goal; x_2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyji'a}, {posyselji'a} for unambiguous semantics).   See also {cirko}, {jivna}, {talsa}, {cnemu}, {prali}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {bradi}, {kargu}, {kelci}.

jinku.definition: x_1 is a vaccine/immune-system stimulant protecting x_2 against disease x_3 introduced by method x_4.

jinme.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of made of metal of composition including x_2.

jinru.definition: x_1 (object/person) is immersed/submerged/bathes in liquid x_2.

jinsa.definition: x_1 (object) is clean/pure of material/contaminant/dirt x_2 by standard x_3.

jinto.definition: x_1 is a well/spring of fluid x_2 at location x_3.

jinvi.definition: x_1 thinks/opines x_2 [opinion] (du'u) is true about subject/issue x_3 on grounds x_4.
jinvi.note: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {djuno}, {krici}, {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {senpi}, {sidbo}, {birti}, {pinka}.

jinzi.definition: x_1 (property - ka) is an innate/inherent/intrinsic/natural property/quality/aspect of x_2.

jipci.definition: x_1 is a chicken/[hen/cock/rooster]/small fowl [a type of bird] of species/breed x_2.

jipno.definition: x_1 is a tip/point/vertex/extremity/end [0-dimension shape/form] on object x_2 at locus x_3.

jirna.definition: x_1 is a/the horn [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: pointed extremity].

jisra.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of juice/nectar from-source/of-type x_2.
jisra.note: Water-based extract from a (generally) biological source. See also {pinxe}, {djacu}, {grute}, {stagi}.

jitfa.definition: x_1 (du'u) is false/is an untruth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics x_2.
jitfa.note: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {fatci}, {stace}, {jetnu}, {cfika}.

jitro.definition: x_1 has control over/harnesses/manages/directs/conducts x_2 in x_3 (activity/event/performance).
jitro.note: x_2 are aspects/individuals controlled within activity/event x_3; manage (= {selzuktro}, {selzukfu'e}, {gu'etro}, {gunfu'e}, {xaktro}, {xakfu'e}) (as distinct from manager/boss = {gunterbe'e}, {gunja'a}, {gunmi'e}, {gunca'i}).  (cf. cmavo list {ji'o}, {bapli}, te {bende}, {gidva} - which does not necessarily control or command, {jatna}, {macnu}, {minde}, {ponse}, {ralju}, {rinka}, {sazri}, {turni}, {vlipa}, {xance}, {xlura})

jivbu.definition: x_1 weaves x_2 from material/[yarn] x_3.

jivna.definition: x_1 competes/vies with opponent x_2 in contest/competition x_3 (event) for gain x_4; x_1 rivals x_2.
jivna.note: Also x_2 opponent(s), competitor(s), rival(s); x_3 competition, race; x_4 prize, reward, recognition (gain may be internal or external).  See also {cnemu}, {jinga}, {talsa}, {bradi}, {fapro}, {kelci}.

jmaji.definition: x_1 (mass/jo'u) gathers/collects at location x_2 from locations x_3 (mass/jo'u).

jmifa.definition: x_1 is a shoal [shallow hazard]/reef of material x_2 in body of water x_3.

jmina.definition: x_1 adds/combines x_2 to/with x_3, with result x_4; x_1 augments x_2 by amount x_3.

jmive.definition: x_1 lives/is alive by standard x_2; x_1 is an organism/living thing.
jmive.note: (adjective:) x_1 is vital, organic.  See also {lifri}, {morsi}, {stuzi}, {zvati}, {xabju}.

jordo.definition: x_1 reflects Jordanian culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

jorne.definition: x_1 is joined to/connects to/is united with x_2 at common locus x_3; x_1 and x_2 are a union.
jorne.note: Also joined/fastened/attached by joint x_3/by means of x_3/with fastener x_3; fastener (= {jo'etci}, {jonvelyla'a}); train, sequence of joined objects (= {jonpoi}; {porjo'e} for a single object joined into a sequence).  See also {lasna}, {fenso}, {kansa}, {pencu}, {penmi}.

jubme.definition: x_1 is a table/flat solid upper surface of material x_2, supported by legs/base/pedestal x_3.

judri.definition: x_1 is an address of/are coordinates of x_2 in system x_3.

jufra.definition: x_1 (text) is a sentence/statement about x_2 [topic/subject/predicate/focus] in language x_3.

jukni.definition: x_1 is a spider/arachnid/crustacean/crab/lobster/non-insect arthropod of species/breed x_2.
jukni.note: Due to the unusual grouping of concepts in this definition, {ankabuta} is favored for "spider". See also {cinki}, {danlu}.

jukpa.definition: x_1 cooks/prepares food-for-eating x_2 by recipe/method x_3 (process).
jukpa.note: Cook with heat (= {glajukpa}, {glaterjukpa}), bake (= {tokyjukpa}); fry (= {rasyjukpa}).  See also {cupra}, {bredi}.

julne.definition: x_1 is a net/filter allowing passage of x_2, prohibiting passage of x_3, netting properties x_4.

jundi.definition: x_1 is attentive towards/attends/tends/pays attention to object/affair x_2.

jungo.definition: x_1 reflects Chinese [Mandarin, Cantonese, Wu, etc.] culture/nationality/language in aspect x_2.

junla.definition: x_1 is clock/watch/timer measuring time units x_2 to precision x_3 with timing mechanism/method x_4.

junri.definition: x_1 (person) is serious/earnest/has gravity about x_2 (event/state/activity).

junta.definition: x_1 is the weight of object x_2 in [gravitational or other force] field x_3.

jurme.definition: x_1 is a bacterium/germ/microbe/protozoan/amoeba [1-celled life] of species/defining property x_2.

jutsi.definition: x_1 is a species of genus x_2, family x_3, etc.; [open-ended tree-structure categorization].
jutsi.note: Also subspecies, order, phylum; (places do not correspond to specific levels in the hierarchy; rather, x_1 is at a "lower" or "bushier" part of the tree than x_2, x_2 is "lower" than x_3, etc.; skipping a place thus means that there is one or more known-and-unspecified levels of hierarchy between the two); not limited to Linnean animal/plant taxonomy.  See also {klesi}, {lanzu}.

juxre.definition: x_1 (action) is clumsy/awkward by standard x_2.

jvinu.definition: x_1 is the view/scene/panorama/sight/prospect of x_2 (object/location) from point-of-view x_3.
jvinu.note: Also x_1 is on display to x_2/x_3.  See also {catlu}, {kanla}, {viska}, {canko}, {jarco}.

kabri.definition: x_1 is a cup/glass/tumbler/mug/vessel/[bowl] containing contents x_2, and of material x_3.
kabri.note: A kabri is normally eaten from by lifting it; a palta is not.  See also {palta}, {citka}, {blaci}, {tansi}.

kacma.definition: x_1 is a camera/photographic equipment recording illumination type x_2 images to medium x_3.

kadno.definition: x_1 reflects Canadian culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

kafke.definition: x_1 coughs/farts/burps up/out x_2 [predominantly gaseous] from orifice x_3.

kagni.definition: x_1 is a company/corporation/firm/partnership chartered by authority x_2 for purpose x_3.

kajde.definition: x_1 (event/experience) warns/cautions x_2 (person) of/about danger x_3 (event/state/property).
kajde.note: Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}).  See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

kajna.definition: x_1 is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object x_2, for purpose x_3.

kakne.definition: x_1 is able to do/be/capable of doing/being x_2 (event/state) under conditions x_3 (event/state).
kakne.note: Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}).  (cf. {stati}, {certu}, {gasnu} (in the time-free potential sense), {cmavo} list {ka'e}, cmavo list {nu'o}, cmavo list {pu'i}, {djuno}, {zifre})

kakpa.definition: x_1 (agent) digs x_2 [material] up/out of x_3 [source/hole] with limbs/tool(s) x_4.
kakpa.note: Also x_1 cuts into x_3 (with material removal).  See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.

kalci.definition: x_1 is a/the feces/excrement/dung/shit of x_2 (animal/person); (adjective:) x_1 is fecal (matter).

kalri.definition: x_1 (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to x_2 by x_3.
kalri.note: As a doorway. x_3 is given access to x_2 through portal x_1. See also {ganlo}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}.

kalsa.definition: x_1 is chaotic/disordered in property/aspect x_2 (ka).

kalte.definition: x_1 hunts/stalks prey/quarry/game x_2 for purpose x_3.
kalte.note: Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}).  See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.

kamju.definition: x_1 is a column/pillar of material x_2.

kamni.definition: x_1 (mass) is a committee with task/purpose x_2 of body x_3.

kampu.definition: x_1 (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set x_2 (complete set).
kampu.note: Only fully universal sense applies; x_1 must be found in all members of x_2.  For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}.  See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.

kanba.definition: x_1 is a goat/angora/[billy-goat/kid] of species/breed x_2.

kancu.definition: x_1 (agent) counts the number in set x_2 to be x_3 [number/count] counting [off] by units x_4.

kandi.definition: x_1 is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property x_2 (ka) as received/measured by observer x_3.
kandi.note: In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness).  See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

kanji.definition: x_1 calculates/reckons/computes x_2 [value (ni)/state] from data x_3 by process x_4.

kanla.definition: x_1 is a/the eye [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) x_1 is ocular.

kanro.definition: x_1 is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard x_2.

kansa.definition: x_1 is with/accompanies/is a companion of x_2, in state/condition/enterprise x_3 (event/state).
kansa.note: x_1 is together with/along with x_2. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.

kantu.definition: x_1 is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity x_2.
kantu.note: Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}).  (cf. {selci} for masses and most objects; {ratni}, {gradu}, {gusni}, {nejni}, {linji})

kanxe.definition: x_1 is a conjunction, stating that x_2 (du'u) and x_3 (du'u) are both true.

karbi.definition: x_1 [observer] compares x_2 with x_3 in property x_4 (ka), determining comparison x_5 (state).

karce.definition: x_1 is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying x_2, propelled by x_3

karda.definition: x_1 is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material x_2, shape x_3.

kargu.definition: x_1 (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to x_2 by standard x_3.
kargu.note: x_1 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {poskargu} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.

karli.definition: x_1 is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding x_2 made of material x_3.

karni.definition: x_1 is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content x_2 published by x_3 for audience x_4.
karni.note: x_2 may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list.  See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

katna.definition: x_1 (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides x_2 (object) into pieces x_3.
katna.note: For x_1 force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}).  (cf. {kakpa}, {sraku} for cutting into without division; {plixa}, {dakfu}, {jinci}, {porpi}, {spofu}, {tunta}, {xrani}, {fatri}, {fendi}, {balre}, {dilcu})

kavbu.definition: x_1 captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs x_2 with trap/restraint x_3.
kavbu.note: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}).  See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

kecti.definition: x_1 (person) pities/feels sorry for x_2 (person) about x_3 (abstraction).

kelci.note: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

kelvo.definition: x_1 is x_2 degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard x_3.

kenra.definition: x_1 is a cancer [malignant disease] in x_2.

kensa.definition: x_1 is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region x_2.

kerfa.definition: x_1 is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of x_2 at body location x_3.

kerlo.definition: x_1 is a/the ear [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].

ketco.definition: x_1 reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect x_2.

kevna.definition: x_1 is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in x_2; x_1 is concave within x_2; x_2 is hollow at locus x_1.
kevna.note: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

kicne.definition: x_1 cushions x_2 with material x_3; x_1 is a cushion/pillow/pad [for x_2] of padding material x_3.

kijno.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of oxygen (O); [metaphor: supporting life/combustion].

kilto.definition: x_1 is a thousand [1000; 10^3] of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

kinli.definition: x_1 is sharp/keen at locus x_2.

kisto.definition: x_1 reflects Pakistani/Pashto culture/nationality/language in aspect x_2.

klaji.definition: x_1 is a street/avenue/lane/drive/cul-de-sac/way/alley/[road] at x_2 accessing x_3.
klaji.note: Also corridor; not typically a route between points, but offers access to sites along it.  See also {naxle}, {panka}, {pluta}, {dargu}.

klaku.definition: x_1 weeps/cries tears x_2 about/for reason x_3 (event/state).

klama.definition: x_1 comes/goes to destination x_2 from origin x_3 via route x_4 using means/vehicle x_5.
klama.note: Also travels, journeys, moves, leaves to ... from ...; x_1 is a traveller; (x_4 as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly).  See also {cadzu}, {bajra}, {marce}, {vofli}, {litru}, {muvdu}, {cpare}, cmavo list {ka'a}, {pluta}, {bevri}, {farlu}, {limna}, {vitke}.

klani.definition: x_1 is a quantity quantified/measured/enumerated by x_2 (quantifier) on scale x_3 (si'o).
klani.note: Also count.  See also cmavo list {la'u}, {namcu}.

klesi.definition: x_1 (mass/si'o) is a class/category/subgroup/subset within x_2 with defining property x_3 (ka).
klesi.note: Also taxon, type, kind, classification, species, genus, family, order, phylum.  See also cmavo list {le'a}, {cmima}, {jutsi}, {ciste}, {girzu}, {lanzu}, {vrici}.

klina.definition: x_1 (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear x_2 [transmission].
klina.note: Also lucid; x_2 remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}).  (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')

kliru.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type x_2 [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].
kliru.note: Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.

kliti.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including x_2.

klupe.definition: x_1 is a screw [fastener] for purpose x_2, threads [pitch, material] x_3, frame [size, material] x_4.

kluza.definition: x_1 (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on x_2 (obj.) at locus x_3.

kobli.definition: x_1 is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain x_2.

kojna.definition: x_1 is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on x_2, of material x_3.
kojna.note: Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.

kolme.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source x_2.

komcu.definition: x_1 is a comb [many-needled shape] of material x_2 with tines/needles x_3.

konju.definition: x_1 is a cone [shape/form] of material x_2 with vertex x_3.

korbi.definition: x_1 is an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of x_2 next-to/bordering-on x_3.

korcu.definition: (adjective:) x_1 is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded.

korka.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of cork/bark from tree/species x_2; [material].

kosta.definition: x_1 is a coat/jacket/sweater/cloak/[cape/shawl/pullover] [extra outer garment] of material x_2.

kramu.definition: x_1 is x_2 local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard x_3, x_4 subunits.
kramu.note: (additional subunit places may be added as x_5, x_6, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.

krasi.definition: x_1 (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of x_2 (object/event/process).
krasi.note: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) x_1 is initial.  See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.

krati.definition: x_1 represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] x_2 in matter(s)/function(s) x_3.
krati.note: Also: on behalf of.  See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.

krefu.definition: x_1 (event) is the x_3'rd recurrence/repetition of x_2 (abstract); x_2 happens again in [form] x_1.
krefu.note: Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion.  See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.

krici.definition: x_1 believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed x_2 (du'u) is true/assumed about subject x_3.
krici.note: without evidence refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction.  See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.

krili.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition x_2 in form/arrangement x_3.
krili.note: x_2: composition including x_2, which need not be complete specification.  See also {jemna}, {bisli}.

krinu.definition: x_1 (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting x_2 (event/state).
krinu.note: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

krixa.definition: x_1 cries out/yells/howls sound x_2; x_1 is a crier.

kruca.definition: x_1 intersects/crosses/traverses x_2 at locus x_3.

kruji.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition x_2.
kruji.note: [x_2: composition including x_2, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

kruvi.definition: x_1 is a curve/turn/bend in x_2, at locus x_3, and defined by set of points/properties x_4.
kruvi.note: (adjective:) x_1 is curved; (x_4 as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

kubli.definition: x_1 is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions x_2 (def. 3), surfaces/sides x_3 (def. 6).
kubli.note: (cf. {kurfa} - needed for 'cube', {bliku} for a physical object; {tanbo}, {tapla}, {tarmi})

kucli.definition: x_1 is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] x_2 (object/abstract).

kufra.definition: x_1 feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) x_2.

kukte.definition: x_1 is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense x_2 [person, or sensory activity].
kukte.note: x_1 is a delicacy.  See also {gusta}, {ralci}, {vrusi}, {cpina}.

kulnu.definition: x_1 [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos x_2 (mass); x_1 is ethnic.
kulnu.note: (note that x_2 is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait).  See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.

kumfa.definition: x_1 is a room of/in structure x_2 surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor x_3 (mass/jo'u).

kumte.definition: x_1 is a camel/llama/alpaca/vicuna/dromedary of species/breed x_2.
kumte.note: Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}).  See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.

kunra.definition: x_1 is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal x_2 mined from location/lode/mine x_3.

kunti.definition: x_1 [container] is empty/vacant of x_2 [material]; x_1 is hollow.
kunti.note: Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada).  See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.

kurfa.definition: x_1 is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices x_2, dimensions x_3 (default 2).
kurfa.note: Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}).  See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.

kurji.definition: x_1 takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for x_2 (object/event/person).
kurji.note: Also tends, cares for, keeps; x_1 is a keeper/custodian of x_2.  See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.

kurki.definition: x_1 is bitter/acrid/sharply disagreeable to observer/sense x_2.

kusru.definition: x_1 (person) is cruel/mean/unkind to victim x_2.

labno.definition: x_1 is a wolf/lupine of species/breed x_2.

lacpu.definition: x_1 pulls/tugs/draws/drags x_2 by handle/at locus x_3.

lacri.definition: x_1 relies/depends/counts on/trusts x_2 to bring about/ensure/maintain x_3 (event/state).

ladru.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of milk from source x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is lactic/dairy.

lafti.definition: x_1 (force) lifts/applies raising/supporting force to x_2 at locus x_3 in gravity well x_4.
lafti.note: (x_1 may be an abstract); verb lift/raise/elevate (= {lafmuvgau}). See also {farlu}, {plipe}.

lakne.definition: x_1 (event/state/property) is probable/likely under conditions x_2.

lakse.definition: x_1 is quantity of wax [substance especially soft/moldable when warm] from source x_2.

lalxu.definition: x_1 is a lake/lagoon/pool at site/within land mass x_2.

lamji.definition: x_1 is adjacent/beside/next to/in contact with x_2 in property/sequence x_3 in direction x_4.
lamji.note: Also touching, contiguous, against.  See also {zvati}, {cpana}, {jibni}, {diklo}, {stuzi}, {bartu}, {jbini}.

lanbi.definition: x_1 is a quantity of protein/albumin of type x_2 composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u) x_3 .

lanci.definition: x_1 is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing x_2 with pattern(s) x_3 on material x_4.

lanka.definition: x_1 is a basket with contents x_2, woven from material x_3.

lanli.definition: x_1 analyzes/examines-in-detail x_2 by method/technique/system x_3 [process/activity].

lanme.definition: x_1 is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed x_2 of flock x_3.
