lante.definition: x_1 is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents x_2, made of x_3.

lanxe.definition: x_1 is in balance/equilibrium under forces x_2 (mass).

lanzu.definition: x_1 (mass) is a family with members including x_2 bonded/tied/joined according to standard x_3.
lanzu.note: Also clan, tribe; x_2 is in x_1, a member of x_1 ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

larcu.definition: x_1 (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill x_2 (idea/activity).

lasna.definition: x_1 (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes x_2 to x_3 with fastener x_4.
lasna.note: No implication that result is considered a single object; although x_2 and x_3 may be reversible, x_3 may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which x_2 becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.

lastu.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including x_2.

latmo.definition: x_1 reflects Latin/Roman/Romance culture/empire/language in aspect x_2.

latna.definition: x_1 is a lotus, plant/flower/herb of species/strain x_2 symbolizing x_3 to culture/religion x_4.

lazni.definition: x_1 (person) is lazy/avoiding work/effort concerning action x_2.

lebna.note: Also confiscate, appropriate.  Acquire with volition such that x_1 gains possession; x_3 is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied.  (cf. {punji}, {cpacu} where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, {vimcu} for alienation where x_1 need not gain possession, {canci}, {cliva})

lenjo.definition: x_1 is a lens/glass [focussing shape/form] focussing x_2 to focus/foci x_3 by means/material x_4.
lenjo.note: (adjective:) x_1 is optical; focussing may be optical or otherwise, hence x_2 which may be light, sound, X-ray, etc., default is light/optical lens; ka is refraction. See also {kacma}, {minra}.

lenku.definition: x_1 is cold/cool by standard x_2.

lerci.definition: x_1 (event) is late by standard x_2.

lerfu.definition: x_1 (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set x_2 representing x_3.
lerfu.note: Also x_1 glyph, rune, character (also me'o BY/word-bu), x_2 symbol set; (adjective:) x_1 is alphabetic/symbolic; "letteral" used by analogy with "numeral"; sinxa is the more generic symbol.  See also {mifra}, {namcu}, {sinxa}, {pandi}.

libjo.definition: x_1 reflects Libyan culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

lidne.definition: x_1 precedes/leads x_2 in sequence x_3; x_1 is former/preceding/previous; x_2 is latter/following.
lidne.note: Also x_1 before, forerunner; leading, as in 'leading indicators'; x_2 after, trailing (= {selyli'e} for reordered places).  See also cmavo list {li'e}, {balvi}, {ralju}, {rebla}, {purci} for time sequence, {jersi}, {porsi}, {jatna}, {farna}.

lifri.definition: x_1 [person/passive/state] undergoes/experiences x_2 (event/experience); x_2 happens to x_1.
lifri.note: Also has/have (of events/experiences); (adjective:) x_1 is empirical; suggests passive undergoing but does not exclude active (per zukte) intent; a deserved experience: reward or punishment (= {jernyfri}, {zanjernyfri}, {maljernyfri}).  See also cmavo list {ri'i}, {jmive}, {fasnu}, {renvi}.

lijda.definition: x_1 is a religion of believers including x_2 sharing common beliefs/practices/tenets including x_3.
lijda.note: Also mythos, creed, traditional beliefs, x_2 people(s), adherents; (adjective:) x_1, x_2, x_3 are religious/ecclesiastic in nature; x_2 is a believer in/of x_1, an adherent/follower of x_1 (= {seljda} for reordered places); x_2 is a practitioner of x_3 (= {selterjda} for reordered places); x_3 is a tenet/belief/ritual/creed of x_1/x_2 (= {terjda} for reordered places); priest/clerical (= {jdaca'i}, {jdaka'i}, {jdaja'a}); organized church/religion (= {be'ejda}); congregation (= {jdabe'e}, {jdagri}).  See also {budjo}, {censa}, {cevni}, {crida}, {dadjo}, {jegvo}, {krici}, {latna}, {malsi}, {marde}, {muslo}, {pruxi}, {ranmi}, {ritli}, {xriso}, {zekri}.

lindi.definition: x_1 is lightning/electrical arc/thunderbolt striking at/extending to x_2 from x_3.

linji.definition: x_1 is a line/among lines [1-dimensional shape/form] defined by set of points x_2.

linsi.definition: x_1 is a length of chain/links of material x_2 with link properties x_3.

linto.definition: x_1 is light in mass/weight by standard x_2.
linto.note: (cf. junta, tilju; se xalbo, kandi for metaphor)

lisri.definition: x_1 is a story/tale/yarn/narrative about plot/subject/moral x_2 by storyteller x_3 to audience x_4.
lisri.note: Also legend; a narrative need not be fictional; x_2 may be merely a convention rather than a subject; also x_3 tells/recounts story/tale x_1 about x_2 to x_4 (= {selterlisri} for place reordering); note that the storyteller need not be the author.  See also {ranmi}, {cfika}, {skicu}, {prosa}, {pemci}.

liste.definition: x_1 (physical object) is a list/catalog/register of sequence/set x_2 in order x_3 in medium x_4.
liste.note: Also roll, log.  (x_2 is completely specified); (cf. {porsi}, {girzu}, {cmima} for mental objects wherein order is of varying importance; some manifested order is intrinsic to a physical list, but the specific order may be incidental and not intentional/purposeful)

litce.definition: x_1 is x_2 liter(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard x_3.

litki.definition: x_1 is liquid/fluid, of composition/material including x_2, under conditions x_3.
litki.note: Conditions include temperature and pressure.  See also {cilmo}, {djacu}, {lumci}, {runta}, {pambe}, {sudga}, {gapci}, {sligu}, {flecu}, {jduli}.

litru.definition: x_1 travels/journeys/goes/moves via route x_2 using means/vehicle x_3; x_1 is a traveller.
litru.note: (x_2 as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly); See also {bajra}, {cadzu}, {cpare}, {tcana}, {klama}, {cliva}, {pluta}, {limna}, {muvdu}.

livga.definition: x_1 is a/the liver [body-part] of x_2.

livla.definition: x_1 is a fuel/energy-source for powering x_2.

logji.definition: x_1 [rules/methods] is a logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about x_2 (du'u).
logji.note: Also (adjective:) x_1, x_2 are logical.  See also {nibli}.

lojbo.definition: x_1 reflects [Loglandic]/Lojbanic language/culture/nationality/community in aspect x_2.
lojbo.note: Pre-Lojban forms of Loglan (= {dzejbo}). See also {bangu}, {logji}.

loldi.definition: x_1 is a floor/bottom/ground of x_2.
loldi.note: Floor/level/story of a building/edifice (= {setloi}, {dijysenta}).  See also {bitmu}, {drudi}, {dertu}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {zbepi}, {sarji}, {serti}.

lorxu.definition: x_1 is a fox [bushy-tailed wild dog/canine] of species/breed x_2.

lubno.definition: x_1 reflects Lebanese culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

lujvo.definition: x_1 (text) is a compound predicate word with meaning x_2 and arguments x_3 built from metaphor x_4.

lumci.definition: x_1 (agent) washes/cleanses x_2 of soil/contaminant x_3 in/with cleaning material(s) x_4.

lunbe.definition: x_1 is bare/naked/nude; x_1 is without cover/clothes/[protection].

lunra.definition: x_1 is Earth's moon (default); x_1 is a major natural satellite/moon of planet x_2.

lunsa.definition: x_1 condenses/liquefies on/into x_2 at temperature x_3, pressure x_4; x_1 is dew/condensate on x_2.

mabla.definition: x_1 is execrable/deplorable/wretched/shitty/awful/rotten/miserable/contemptible/crappy/inferior/low-quality in property x_2 by standard x_3; x_1 stinks/sucks in aspect x_2 according to x_3.
mabla.note: Bloody (British sense), fucking, shit, goddamn. See also {zabna}, {xlali}, {palci}, {dapma}, {funca}, {ganti}, {ganxo}, {gletu}, {gutra}, {kalci}, {pinca}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}, {zargu}.

mabru.definition: x_1 is a mammal/'animal'/beast of species x_2.

macnu.definition: x_1 (event/action/process) is manual [not automatic] in function x_2 under conditions x_3.

makcu.definition: x_1 is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality x_2 (ka).

makfa.definition: x_1 is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to x_2, performed by person/force/deity x_3.

maksi.definition: x_1 is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field x_2.

malsi.definition: x_1 is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion x_2 at location/serving area x_3.
malsi.note: x_2 may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

mamta.definition: x_1 is a mother of x_2; x_1 bears/mothers/acts maternally toward x_2; [not necessarily biological].

manfo.definition: x_1 (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property x_2 (ka).

manri.definition: x_1 is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining x_2, with/by rules x_3.
manri.note: (x_1 may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

mansa.definition: x_1 satisfies evaluator x_2 in property (ka)/state x_3.

manti.definition: x_1 is an ant of species/breed x_2.

mapku.definition: x_1 is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material x_2.

mapni.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].

mapti.definition: x_1 fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with x_2 in property/aspect x_3.

marbi.definition: x_1 is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting x_2 from danger/threat x_3.

marce.definition: x_1 is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying x_2 in/on surface/medium x_3, propelled by x_4.

marde.definition: x_1 are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of x_2 (ind./mass) about situation x_3.
marde.note: x_1 will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

margu.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].

marji.definition: x_1 is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including x_2 in shape/form x_3.
marji.note: Also (adjective:) x_1 is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

marna.definition: x_1 is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain x_2.

marxa.definition: x_1 [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes x_2 into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass x_3.

masno.definition: x_1 is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about x_2 (event/state).

masti.definition: x_1 is x_2 months in duration (default is 1 month) by month standard x_3.
masti.note: This month (= {cabma'i}); next month (= {bavla'ima'i}); last month (= {prula'ima'i}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {nanca}.

matci.definition: x_1 is a mat/pad/mattress/pallet [flat, soft, dense form] of material x_2.

matli.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of linen/flax [type of fabric/material].

matne.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains butter/oleo/margarine/shortening from source x_2.
matne.note: (adjective:) x_1 is buttery; an edible fat, solid but spreadable at normal temperatures; dairy butter (= {ladmatne}).  See also {grasu}, {kruji}.

matra.definition: x_1 is a motor/engine, driving/propelling/providing power to x_2.

mavji.definition: x_1 is a quantity of oats [grain] of species/strain x_2.

maxri.definition: x_1 is a quantity of wheat [grain] of species/strain x_2.

mebri.definition: x_1 is a/the brow/forehead [projecting flat/smooth head/body-part] of x_2.

megdo.definition: x_1 is a million [10^6] of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

mekso.definition: x_1 [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention x_2.

melbi.definition: x_1 is beautiful/pleasant to x_2 in aspect x_3 (ka) by aesthetic standard x_4.
melbi.note: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful.  See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

meljo.definition: x_1 reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect x_2.

menli.definition: x_1 is a mind/intellect/psyche/mentality/[consciousness] of body x_2.
menli.note: (adjective:) x_1 is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}).  See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.

mensi.definition: x_1 is a sister of/sororal to x_2 by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) x_3; [not necessarily biological].

mentu.definition: x_1 is x_2 minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard x_3.

merko.definition: x_1 pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect x_2.

merli.definition: x_1 (agent) measures/evaluates x_2 [quantity] as x_3 units on scale x_4 (si'o), with accuracy x_5.

mexno.definition: x_1 reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

midju.definition: x_1 is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is central.

mifra.definition: x_1 is encoded/cipher text of plain-text x_2 by code/coding system x_3; x_1 is in code; x_3 is a code.

mikce.definition: x_1 doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to x_2 for ailment x_3 by treatment/cure x_4.
mikce.note: Also medic; (adjective:) x_1, x_4 is medical; x_2 is a patient of x_1 (= selmikce for reordered places) ; x_2 is treated by x_1 person/x_4 treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the x_1 and x_4 of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}).  See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

mikri.definition: x_1 is a millionth [10^{-6}] of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

milti.definition: x_1 is a thousandth [1/1000; 10^{-3}] of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

milxe.definition: x_1 is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property x_2 (ka); x_1 is not very x_2.

minde.definition: x_1 issues commands/orders to x_2 for result x_3 (event/state) to happen; x_3 is commanded to occur.
minde.note: [also: x_1 orders/sets/Triggers. x_2 to do/bring about x_3; x_1 is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

minji.definition: x_1 is a machine for use/function x_2; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
minji.note: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}).  See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

minli.definition: x_1 is x_2 (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], x_3 subunits, standard x_4.
minli.note: (additional subunit places may be added as x_5, x_6, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

minra.definition: x_1 reflects/mirrors/echoes x_2 [object/radiation] to observer/point x_3 as x_4; x_2 bounces on x_1.
minra.note: Also: x_1 is a mirror/reflector.  x_2 may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; x_4 may be image or echo or the same as x_2 if physical object; x_3 may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection.  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

mintu.definition: x_1 is the same/identical thing as x_2 by standard x_3; (x_1 and x_2 interchangeable).
mintu.note: (cf. {panra}, {satci}, {mapti}, {simsa}, {drata}, {dunli}, cmavo list {du} - which has no standard place, {simxu})

mipri.definition: x_1 keeps x_2 secret/hidden from x_3 by method x_4; x_2 is a secret; x_1 hides/conceals x_2.
mipri.note: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}).  See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

mirli.definition: x_1 is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed x_2.

misno.definition: x_1 (person/object/event) is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons x_2 (mass).
misno.note: Also celebrated/well-known; (derogative meanings:) notorious/infamous (= {malmi'o}; these could also be expressed using the referenced words).  See also se {sinma}, {banli}.

misro.definition: x_1 reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

mitre.definition: x_1 is x_2 meter(s) [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction x_3 by standard x_4.

mixre.definition: x_1 (mass) is a mixture/blend/colloid/commingling with ingredients including x_2.
mixre.note: x_2 mingles/mixes/blends into x_1; x_2 is in x_1, an ingredient/part/component/element of x_1 (= {selxre} for reordered places).  See also {salta}, te {runta}, {stasu}, {jicla}, {sanso}.

mlana.definition: x_1 is to the side of/lateral to x_2 and facing x_3 from point of view/in-frame-of-reference x_4.
mlana.note: (cf. {crane}, {trixe}, {pritu}, {zunle} which differ in that the direction of facing is the front and not the lateral side.  The x_4 of mlana may be either the front, or back side of x_2, {korbi})

mlatu.definition: x_1 is a cat/[puss/pussy/kitten] [feline animal] of species/breed x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is feline.

mleca.definition: x_1 is less than x_2 in property/quantity x_3 (ka/ni) by amount x_4.
mleca.note: Also negative (= {nonme'a}).  See also cmavo list {me'a}, cmavo list {su'o}, {jdika}, {zmadu}, {traji}.

mledi.definition: x_1 is a mold/fungus/mushrooms/truffles of species/strain x_2 parasitic/growing on x_3.

mluni.definition: x_1 is a satellite/moon orbiting x_2 with characteristics x_3, orbital parameters x_4.

mokca.definition: x_1 is a point/instant/moment [0-dimensional shape/form] in/on/at time/place x_2.

moklu.definition: x_1 is a/the mouth/oral cavity [body-part] of x_2; (metaphor: entrance/intake for consumption).

molki.definition: x_1 is a mill/foundry/industrial plant/[assembly line] performing process x_2.
molki.note: (unlike fanri,) need not produce a product; grain mill (= {grumlo}), grinding mill (= {zalmlo}, {zalmlotci}, {zalmloca'a}).  See also {gasta}, {gurni}, {tirse}, {fanri}, {zalvi}.

molro.definition: x_1 is x_2 mole(s) [metric unit] in substance (default is 1) by standard x_3.

morji.definition: x_1 remembers/recalls/recollects fact(s)/memory x_2 (du'u) about subject x_3.

morko.definition: x_1 reflects Moroccan culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

morna.definition: x_1 is/reflects/represents a pattern of forms/events x_2 arranged according to structure x_3.
morna.note: [x_3 is a model for x_1 (= {termontai}, or the more abstract = {termonsi'o}); image (= {gusmo'a}, {nenmo'a}, {dairmo'a}, {selylenmo'a}, {selmirmo'a}, {velmirmo'a}, but also all of these -tai instead of -mo'a for the ideal)]; See also {ciste}, {ganzu}, {marji}, {slilu}, {stura}, {tarmi}, {boxna}, {cimde}, {gidva}, {jimpe}, {rilti}.

morsi.definition: x_1 is dead/has ceased to be alive.

mosra.definition: x_1 is friction [force opposing motion] due to contact/rubbing between x_2 and x_3; (fe) x_2 rubs x_3.
mosra.note: Also x_2 scrubs/wipes/brushes (against) x_3 (= {seltermosra}); non-agentive rub (= {termosra}).  See also {sakli}, {sraku}, {jabre}, {satre}, {guska}, {pencu}, {spali}.

mraji.definition: x_1 is a quantity of rye [grain] of species/strain x_2.

mrilu.definition: x_1 mails/posts [transfer via intermediary service] x_2 to recipient address x_3 from mailbox/post office/sender address x_4 by carrier/network/system x_5.
mrilu.note: Also x_4 post office, mailbox.  (cf. {benji} In which the medium need not be a 3rd party service/system, and x_2 need not consist of discrete units.  {notci}, {xatra}, {tcana})

mruli.definition: x_1 [tool] is a hammer for/hammers x_2 [target] consisting of weight/head x_3 propelled by x_4.

mucti.definition: x_1 is immaterial/not physical/without material form.

mudri.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains wood/lumber from tree(s) of type/species x_2.

mukti.definition: x_1 (action/event/state) motivates/is a motive/incentive for action/event x_2, per volition of x_3.
mukti.note: Also; x_3 is motivated to bring about result/goal/objective x_2 by x_1 (= {termu'i} for reordered places); (note that 'under conditions' BAI may apply and be appropriately added to the main predicate level or within the x_2 action level).  (cf. cmavo list {mu'i}, {nibli}, te {zukte} - generally better for 'goal', se {jalge}, {krinu}, {rinka}, {ciksi}, {djica}, {xlura})

mulno.definition: x_1 (event) is complete/done/finished; x_1 (object) has become whole in property x_2 by standard x_3.
mulno.note: Also perfected, entirety; (adverb/adjective:) entire, total, integral, fully, totally, wholly, completely, entirely.  See also {fanmo}, {culno}, {pagbu}, {xadba}, {prane}, {jalge}, {sumji}, {munje}, {sisti}, {xadni}.

munje.definition: x_1 is a universe/cosmos [complete and ordered entirety] of domain/sphere x_2 defined by rules x_3.
munje.note: Also world; a universe is a kind of system, one which comprehensively encompasses its domain; e.g. 'universe of discourse', or 'world of birds'; x_3 are the rules/defining principles which distinguish the universe from other universes, or from non-universe.  See also {ciste}, {plini}, {kensa}, {mulno}.

mupli.definition: x_1 is an example/sample/specimen/instance/case/illustration of common property(s) x_2 of set x_3.

murse.definition: x_1 is the [astronomical] twilight/dawn/dusk/half-light/glimmering of day x_2 at location x_3.
murse.note: Morning twilight, dawn (= {cermurse}); evening twilight, dusk (= {vacmurse}).  See also {cerni}, {kandi}, {vanci}.

murta.definition: x_1 is a curtain/blinds/drapes for covering/obscuring aperture x_2, and made of material x_3.

muslo.definition: x_1 pertains to the Islamic/Moslem/Koranic [Quranic] culture/religion/nation in aspect x_2.

mutce.definition: x_1 is much/extreme in property x_2 (ka), towards x_3 extreme/direction; x_1 is, in x_2, very x_3.
mutce.note: Also very, pretty, a lot, immoderate/immoderately, intense, quite, extremely.  See also {milxe}, {traji}, {banli}, {carmi}, {nutli}.

muvdu.definition: x_1 (object) moves to destination/receiver x_2 [away] from origin x_3 over path/route x_4.
muvdu.note: Also mobile (= {comymu'u}, for the non-specific opposite of immobile); after a muvdu, object is alienated from/no longer at origin (unless physically returned there, per litru or slilu); agentive move (= {muvgau}, {muvzu'e}), non-agentive transitive move (= {muvri'a}), self-propelled (= {sezmuvgau}), motion of a part of the object (= {pagmu'u}), having a moving part (= {muvypau}, {muvyselpau}); apparent motion (= {mlumu'u}).  (cf. {rinci}, {klama} (which differs in that the means of motion is explicit), {litru}, {cliva}, {fatri}; {dunda}, {benji} for agentive movement that does not necessarily imply alienation from origin, preja for similar movement with no agent implied, {bevri}, {vimcu})

muzga.definition: x_1 is a museum for preserving [and possibly exhibiting] x_2 at location x_3.

nabmi.definition: x_1 (event/state) is a problem to/encountered by x_2 in situation/task/inquiry x_3.
nabmi.note: Also: x_1 requires consideration by x_2.  See also {preti}, {danfu}, {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {jinvi}, {nandu}, {pensi}, {sidbo}, {spuda}, {raktu}.

nakni.definition: x_1 is a male/buck of species x_2 evidencing masculine trait(s) x_3 (ka); x_1 is masculine.

nalci.definition: x_1 is a/the wing [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: lateral supporting surface].

namcu.definition: x_1 (li) is a number/quantifier/digit/value/figure (noun); refers to the value and not the symbol.

nanba.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains bread [leavened or unleavened] made from grains x_2.

nanca.definition: x_1 is x_2 years in duration (default is 1 year) by standard x_3; (adjective:) x_1 is annual.
nanca.note: This year (= {cabna'a}); next year (= {bavlamna'a}); last year (= {prulamna'a}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}.

nandu.definition: x_1 is difficult/hard/challenging for x_2 under conditions x_3; x_1 challenges (non-agentive) x_2.

nanla.definition: x_1 is a boy/lad [young male person] of age x_2 immature by standard x_3.
nanla.note: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use verba).  See also {nixli}, {verba}, {nanmu}, {bersa}.

nanmu.definition: x_1 is a man/men; x_1 is a male humanoid person [not necessarily adult].
nanmu.note: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use remna or prenu).  See also {ninmu}, {remna}, {prenu}, {makcu}, {nanla}, {bersa}.

nanvi.definition: x_1 is a billionth/thousand-millionth [10^{-9}] of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

narge.definition: x_1 is a nut [body-part: hard-shelled fruit] from plant/species x_2 with shell x_3 and kernel x_4.
narge.note: Also x_4 nucleus, center (= {velnarge} for place reordering).  See also {grute}, {stagi}, {jbari}, {midju}.

natfe.definition: x_1 (du'u) contradicts/denies/refutes/negates x_2 (du'u) under rules/logic x_3.
natfe.note: Also exception (= {nafmupli}); agentive contradict/deny (= {nafxu'a} or {tolxu'a}).  See also {nibli}, {tugni}, {zanru}, {xusra}.

natmi.definition: x_1 is a nation/ethnic group of peoples x_2; [people sharing a history/culture].

navni.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of noble gas of type x_2 [helium/neon/argon/krypton/xenon/radon].

naxle.definition: x_1 is a canal/channel to x_2 from x_3 with route x_4.
naxle.note: x_2/x_3 may be unordered.  See also {pluta}, {rirxe}, {klaji}, {dargu}.

nazbi.definition: x_1 is the nose [body-part] of x_2 with nostril(s)/nasal passage(s) x_3; [metaphor: protrusion].

nejni.definition: x_1 is energy of type x_2 in form x_3.

nelci.definition: x_1 is fond of/likes/has a taste for x_2 (object/state).

nenri.definition: x_1 is in/inside/within x_2; x_1 is on the inside/interior of x_2 [totally within the bounds of x_2].
nenri.note: Indicates total containment.  (cf. se {vasru} (for containment that need not be total), {jbini}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {sruri}, {senta}, {snuji}, {bartu}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {jinru}, {setca})

nibli.definition: x_1 logically necessitates/entails/implies action/event/state x_2 under rules/logic system x_3.

nicte.definition: x_1 is a nighttime of day x_2 at location x_3; (adjective:) x_1 is at night/nocturnal.
nicte.note: Tonight (= {cabycte}); tomorrow night (= {bavlamcte}, even when tonight is still in the future); last night (= {prulamcte}).  See also {donri}, {djedi}, {tcika}.

nikle.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of nickel/other metal resistant to oxidation.

nilce.definition: x_1 [furniture items] furnishes x_2 [location] serving purpose/function x_3.

nimre.definition: x_1 is a quantity of citrus [fruit/tree, etc.] of species/strain x_2.

ninmu.definition: x_1 is a woman/women; x_1 is a female humanoid person [not necessarily adult].
ninmu.note: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use remna or prenu).  See also {nanmu}, {remna}, {prenu}, {makcu}, {nixli}.

nirna.definition: x_1 is a nerve/neuron [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: information/control network connection].
nirna.note: Also (adjective:) x_1 is neural.  See also ve {benji}.

nitcu.definition: x_1 needs/requires/is dependent on/[wants] necessity x_2 for purpose/action/stage of process x_3.
nitcu.note: No implication of lack.  See also {banzu}, {cidja}, {claxu}, {pindi}, {xebni}, {sarcu}, {lacri}, {djica}, {taske}, {xagji}.

nivji.definition: x_1 (agent) knits x_2 [cloth/object] from yarn/thread x_3.

nixli.definition: x_1 is a girl [young female person] of age x_2 immature by standard x_3.
nixli.note: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use verba).  See also {nanla}, {verba}, {ninmu}.

nobli.definition: x_1 is noble/aristocratic/elite/high-born/titled in/under culture/society/standard x_2.
nobli.note: Also upper-class; high/low, upper/lower are poor Lojban metaphors; note x_2 standard applies when the title/nobility is not recognized culture/society wide; this would include self-assumed titles.  See also {banli}.

notci.definition: x_1 is a message/notice/memorandum about subject x_2 from author x_3 to intended audience x_4.
notci.note: Emphasis on brevity, single or identifiable subject (contrast with xatra: the emphasis in notci is on the single or cohesively focused subject, while the audience is less defined - indeed only an 'intended' audience.  xatra need not have a single or focussed subject - its corresponding place is for 'content'); reminder/memo/note (= {mojnoi}).  See also {xatra}, {nuzba}, {mrilu}, {morji}.

nurma.definition: x_1 is a rural/rustic/pastoral area of x_2; x_1 is in the country.

nutli.definition: x_1 is neutral/not taking sides/medial/not towards any extreme on scale/in dissension x_2.
nutli.note: Also x_2 dispute/struggle (though x_2 is not limited to disagreements, which is merely one manifestation of scalar or distributed values in which there is a medial position).  See also {midju}, {lanxe}, {milxe}, {mutce}, cmavo list {no'e}.

nuzba.definition: x_1 (du'u) is news/tidings/new information about subject x_2 from source x_3, to observer x_4.

pacna.definition: x_1 hopes/wishes for/desires x_2 (event), expected likelihood x_3 (0-1); x_1 hopes that x_2 happens.
pacna.note: Also: x_1 is hopeful of x_2; x_2 will hopefully occur, as hoped for by x_1; the value of x_3 is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to x_1, and is the basic determinant of whether pacna means 'hope' or 'wish' or 'expect': hoping for objects/states with negligible expectation is "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is "hoping"; when the probability is subjectively near 1, the attitude is described as "expecting"; the value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); wish (= {sotpa'a}), hope (= {sorpa'a}), expect (= {sojypa'a}).  See also {djica}.

pagbu.definition: x_1 is a part/component/piece/portion/segment of x_2 [where x_2 is a whole/mass]; x_2 is partly x_1.

pagre.definition: x_1 passes through/penetrates barrier/medium/portal x_2 to destination side x_3 from origin side x_4.
pagre.note: Passing through in both directions (= rolfargre, pagre ... .i so'ivo'ivo'u (and vice versa)).  See also {bitmu}, {denci}, {ganlo}, {kalri}, {vorme}, {pluta}, {canko}, {ragve}.

pajni.definition: x_1 judges/referees/arbitrates/is a judge determining/deciding matter x_2 (abstract).
pajni.note: x_2 includes jei = rule ({jetpai}), ni = estimate ({lairpai}), ka = evaluate ({kairpai} or {vampai}), or nu = referee/arbitrate ({faurpai}); single events of judging including specific decisions/judgements (= {paijdi}, {jetpaijdi}, {lairpaijdi}, {kairpaijdi}, {vampaijdi}, {faurpaijdi}); jury (= {pairkamni}), serve on a jury (= {kamnypai}, as part of mass x_1).  See also {cuxna}, {jdice}, {vajni}, {cipra}, {zekri}, {manri}, {mansa}.

palci.definition: x_1 is evil/depraved/wicked [morally bad] by standard x_2.

palku.definition: x_1 are pants/trousers/slacks/leggings [legged garment] of material x_2.

palne.definition: x_1 is a tray/platter/flat container [pan/sheet/griddle] of contents x_2, and made of material x_3.
palne.note: Also pallet, when used for carrying rather than support on the ground; a tray is flat-bottomed and shallow or without a rim, and is generally portable.  See also {tansi}, {patxu}, {palta}, {ckana}.

palta.definition: x_1 is a plate/dish/platter/saucer [flat/mildly concave food service bed] made of material x_2.

pambe.definition: x_1 is a pump/injector [tool/apparatus] pumping/inserting fluid x_2 to x_3 from x_4 by means x_5.
pambe.note: x_2 fluid may be liquid or gas; x_5 may be a force; a pump generally causes a pressure gradient, such that x_3 is a place of lower pressure, x_4 a place of higher pressure.  (cf. {gapci}, {litki}, {rinci}; metaphorical use of {fepri} for gas, {risna} for liquid, {rinci}, {tutci})

panci.definition: x_1 is an odor/fragrance/scent/smell emitted by x_2 and detected by observer/sensor x_3.
panci.note: An undetected emitter is odorless to the observer.  See also {nazbi}, {sumne}, {cpina}, {vrusi}.

pandi.definition: x_1 (agent) punctuates x_2 (expression) with symbol/word x_3 with syntactic/semantic effect x_4.

panje.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of sponge/porous material.
panje.note: Also metaphorically used for coral, Swiss cheese.  See also {cokcu} for a generalized absorbant.

panka.definition: x_1 is a park/land reserve managed by community/polity/company x_2 for purpose x_3.

panlo.definition: x_1 is a slice [thin flat portion] of x_2 (mass).

panpi.definition: x_1 is at peace with x_2.

panra.definition: x_1 parallels x_2 differing only in property x_3 (ka; jo'u/fa'u term) by standard/geometry x_4.
panra.note: Also: x_1 is parallel to x_2, x_3 is the only difference between x_1 and x_2 (= {terpanra} for reordered places); x_1 and x_2 are alike/similar/congruent.   A parallel involves extreme close similarity/correspondence across the entirety of the things being compared, generally involving multiple properties, with focus placed on one or a small number of differences. See also {pa'a}, {mintu}, {simsa}, {girzu}, {vrici}.

pante.definition: x_1 protests/objects to/complains about x_2 (event/state) to audience x_3 with action x_4.
pante.note: (x_4 is an event or {tu'a} quotation) See also {xarnu}.

panzi.definition: x_1 is a [biological] offspring/child/kid/hybrid of parent(s) x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is filial.

papri.definition: x_1 is a [physical] page/leaf of book/document/bound mass of pages x_2.
papri.note: Numbered pages (as in a book) are the sides of a page (= {paprysfe}, {paprysfelai}); a pageful of text (= {papryseltcidu}, {paprytcidylai}).  See also {karni}, {pelji}, {prina}, {xatra}, {vreji}, {pezli}, {cukta}, {ciska}.

parbi.definition: x_1 (me'o, fraction) is a ratio/rate of x_2 (quantity) with respect to x_3 (quantity), [x_2:x_3].
parbi.note: Also x_1 fraction/proportion/quotient; x_2 dividend/numerator; x_3 divisor/denominator.  See also {frinu}, {dilcu}, {mekso}.

pastu.definition: x_1 is a robe/tunic/gown/cloak/dress/[coveralls] [a long/full body garment] of material x_2.

patfu.definition: x_1 is a father of x_2; x_1 begets/sires/acts paternal towards x_2; [not necessarily biological].

patlu.definition: x_1 is a potato [an edible tuber] of variety/cultivar x_2.
patlu.note: (use samcu for starchy/tuberous roots that do not reproduce from eyes of tuber); See also {genja}, {jalna}, {samcu}.

patxu.definition: x_1 is a pot/kettle/urn/tub/sink, a deep container for contents x_2, of material/properties x_3.

pelji.definition: x_1 is paper from source x_2.
pelji.note: Sheet of paper (= {plekarda} if shape is important, {plebo'o}).  See also {karni}, {papri}, {prina}.

pemci.definition: x_1 is a poem/verse about plot/theme/subject/pattern x_2 by author x_3 for intended audience x_4.
pemci.note: x_2 may be a convention rather than a subject.  See also {prosa}, {rimni}, {rilti}, {finti}, {lisri}, {sanga}.

penbi.definition: x_1 is a pen using ink x_2 applied by process x_3.

pencu.definition: x_1 (agent) touches x_2 with x_3 [a locus on x_1 or an instrument] at x_4 [a locus on x_2].

pendo.definition: x_1 is/acts as a friend of/to x_2 (experiencer); x_2 befriends x_1.

penmi.definition: x_1 meets/encounters x_2 at/in location x_3.

pensi.definition: x_1 thinks/considers/cogitates/reasons/is pensive about/reflects upon subject/concept x_2.
pensi.note: Also: x_1 is thoughtful (one sense); x_2 is mental (one sense)/intellectual (one sense) (= {selpei}).  See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {jijnu}, {menli}, {morji}, {sidbo}, {jinvi}, se {nabmi}, {minra}, {lanli}, {besna}, {saske}, {skami}.

perli.definition: x_1 is a pear [fruit] of species/strain x_2.

pesxu.definition: x_1 is paste/pulp/dough/mash/mud/slurry [soft, smooth-textured, moist solid] of composition x_2.
pesxu.note: x_2: composition including x_2, which need not be complete specification.  See also {marxa}, {kliti}, {tarla}.

petso.definition: x_1 is 10^15 of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

pezli.definition: x_1 is a leaf of plant x_2; x_1 is foliage of x_2.

picti.definition: x_1 is a trillionth [10^{-12}] of x_2 in dimension/aspect x_3 (default is units).

pijne.definition: x_1 is a pin/peg (needle-shaped tool) for fastening to/piercing x_2, of material/properties x_3.

pikci.definition: x_1 begs/pleads/supplicates/entreats/implores/beseeches/prays [asks with humility] x_2 for x_3.
pikci.note: Also importune, petition, plea, solicit; x_2 benefactor, patron; x_3 boon, favor, gift, alms. See also {cpedu} which is more general as to manner, {pindi}.

pikta.definition: x_1 is a ticket entitling x_2 to entitlement/privilege x_3 (event/state) under conditions x_4.

pilji.definition: x_1 is the product/total/result of factors/multiplicands (x_2 and x_3) x_2 multiplied by x_3.

pilka.definition: x_1 is a crust/rind/peel/skin/hide/outer cover of x_2.
pilka.note: (cf. {grute}, {calku}, {skapi} (pilka as a general term includes skapi), {gacri})

pilno.definition: x_1 uses/employs x_2 [tool, apparatus, machine, agent, acting entity, material] for purpose x_3.
pilno.note: Also utilize; x_2 is useful/used productively by x_1 to do x_3 (= {selpli} for reordered places); hire/employ (= {le'ipli}, {lejyplicu'a}).  (cf. {tutci}, {cabra}, {minji}, {gasnu}, {zukte} for x_2, cmavo list {pi'o}, {sazri}, {jibri})

pimlu.definition: x_1 is a/the feather/plume(s)/plumage [body-part] of animal/species x_2.

pinca.definition: x_1 is a/the urine/piss/pee of x_2.

pindi.definition: x_1 is poor/indigent/impoverished/lacking in goods/possessions/property x_2.
pindi.note: x_2 is scanty/meager/lacking for x_1.  See also {ricfu}, {claxu}, {nitcu}, {pikci}.

pinfu.definition: x_1 is a prisoner/captive of x_2, restrained/held/confined by means/force x_3.

pinji.definition: x_1 is a/the clitoris/penis [projecting reproductive organ; body-part] of x_2.
pinji.note: Normally context eliminates need for specificity; otherwise: penis (= {nakpinji}), clitoris (= {fetpinji}).  See also {cinse}, {gletu}, {vibna}, {plibu}, {vlagi}, {mabla}, {ganti}.

pinka.definition: x_1 (text) is a comment/remark/observation about subject x_2 expressed by x_3 to audience x_4.
pinka.note: Also: x_3 comments/remarks/says x_1 about x_2 (= terselpinka for reordered places).  See also {jinvi}, {cusku}, {zgana}, {lanli}, {bacru}, {ciska}.

pinsi.definition: x_1 is a pencil/crayon/stylus applying lead/marking material x_2, frame/support [of material] x_3.
pinsi.note: Also writing brush; x_1 stimulates substrate medium x_2 to display marks; explicitly denoting a standard lead pencil (= {tabypinsi}).  (cf. {ciska}, {penbi} (unlike the English equivalents, pinsi is the more general term over penbi), {burcu}, {bakri})

pinta.definition: x_1 is flat/level/horizontal in gravity/frame of reference x_2.

pinxe.definition: x_1 (agent) drinks/imbibes beverage/drink/liquid refreshment x_2 from/out-of container/source x_3.

pipno.definition: x_1 is a piano/harpsichord/synthesizer/organ; a keyboard musical instrument.

pixra.definition: x_1 is a picture/illustration representing/showing x_2, made by artist x_3 in medium x_4.
pixra.note: Also (adjective:) x_1 is pictorial/illustrative; drawing (= {xraselci'a}), x_1 draws x_2 (= xraci'a/xraci'a), image (= {xratai}), photo (= {kacmyxra}), take a photo (= {kacmyterxra}, {kacmyxragau}, {kacmyxrazu'e}); sculpture, relief (= {blixra}).  See also {ciska}, {cinta}, {prina}, {mupli}, {barna}, {skina}.

plana.definition: x_1 is plump/fat/obese [excessively thick/bulbous/swollen] by standard x_2.

platu.definition: x_1 (agent) plans/designs/plots plan/arrangement/plot/[schematic] x_2 for state/process x_3.
platu.note: Also invents/organizes; x_2 design, scheme; the structure or layout of an object would be represented as a state in x_3.  See also {cartu}.

pleji.definition: x_1 pays/compensates/remunerates/[rewards] payment x_2 to recipient/payee x_3 for goods/services x_4.
pleji.note: Also x_4 commodities; x_4 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posle'i}, {posyvelyle'i} for unambiguous semantics); rent (= {jerle'i}, {lejyjbera}).  (cf. {canja}, {cnemu}, {friti}, {kargu}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {prali}, {jerna}, {sfasa}, {dunda}, {jinga}, {dapma}; see note at jdima on cost/price/value distinction, {cirko}, {dirba})

plibu.definition: x_1 is a/the pubic area/external genitalia [body-part] of x_2.

plini.definition: x_1 is a planet revolving around x_2 with planetary characteristics x_3, orbital parameters x_4.

plipe.definition: x_1 (agent/object) leaps/jumps/springs/bounds to x_2 from x_3 reaching height x_4 propelled by x_5.
plipe.note: Place structure parallels klama; hence x_4 may be a route-like expression.  See also {bajra}, {stapa}, {cpare}, {lafti}.

plise.definition: x_1 is an apple [fruit] of species/strain x_2.

plita.definition: x_1 is a plane [2-dimensional shape/form] defined by points x_2 (set); x_1 is flat/[smooth].
plita.note: Also: x_1 is even/planar/level.  (x_2 is a set of points at least sufficient to define the plane); See also {xutla}, {sefta}, {tapla}, {karda}, {boxfo}, {pinta}.

plixa.definition: x_1 (agent) plows/furrows/tills [cuts into and turns up] x_2 with tool x_3 propelled by x_4.

pluja.definition: x_1 is complex/complicated/involved in aspect/property x_2 (ka) by standard x_3.

pluka.definition: x_1 (event/state) seems pleasant to/pleases x_2 under conditions x_3.

pluta.definition: x_1 is a route/path/way/course/track to x_2 from x_3 via/defined by points including x_4 (set).
pluta.note: A route merely connects origin/destination, but need not be improved in any way; (x_4 is a set of points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly).  (cf. {litru}, {naxle}, {tcana}, {dargu}, {klaji}, ve {klama}; {tadji}, {zukte} for means to a goal, {klama}, {pagre})

polje.definition: x_1 (force) folds/creases x_2 at locus/loci/forming crease(s)/bend(s) x_3.
polje.note: For agentive folding (= {plogau}, {plozu'e}); use cardinal-value sumti in x_3, or rapli, to indicate multiple folds.  See also {korcu}, {cinje}, {boxfo}, {boxna}.

polno.definition: x_1 reflects Polynesian/Oceanian (geographic region) culture/nationality/languages in aspect x_2.

ponjo.definition: x_1 reflects Japanese culture/nationality/language in aspect x_2.

ponse.definition: x_1 possesses/owns/has x_2 under law/custom x_3; x_1 is owner/proprietor of x_2 under x_3.
ponse.note: (x_3 is generally more important to the concept than commonly accepted for the English equivalent, since the concept is broader when unconstrained, and the nature/interpretation of possession/ownership is very culturally dependent); See also {ckini}, {ralte}, {jitro}, {steci}, {srana}, {tutra}, {turni}, {zivle}.

porsi.definition: x_1 [ordered set] is sequenced/ordered/listed by comparison/rules x_2 on unordered set x_3.
porsi.note: Also (adjective:) x_1 is serial.  (sets are completely specified); See also cmavo list {po'i}, {lidne}, {liste}, {cmima}.

porto.definition: x_1 reflects Portuguese culture/nationality/language in aspect x_2.

prali.definition: x_1 is a profit/gain/benefit/advantage to x_2 accruing/resulting from activity/process x_3.
prali.note: Also (fe) x_2 profits from x_3 (= {selterprali} for reordered places); x_1 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {selposprali} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {jinga}, {canja}, {sfasa}, {jerna}, {jdima}, {dunda}, {zivle}.

prami.definition: x_1 loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards x_2 (object/state).
prami.note: Also: x_1 is loving towards x_2, x_1 is a lover of x_2 (one sense), x_2 is beloved by x_1 (= {selpa'i} for reordered places).  See also {cinmo}, {xebni}, {nelci}, {djica}, {sinma}, {pluka}, {kurji}, {pendo}, {speni}.

preja.definition: x_1 spreads/expands over/into x_2 from initial state x_3.

prenu.definition: x_1 is a person/people (noun) [not necessarily human]; x_1 displays personality/a persona.

preti.definition: x_1 (quoted text) is a question/query about subject x_2 by questioner x_3 to audience x_4.

prije.definition: x_1 is wise/sage about matter x_2 (abstraction) to observer x_3.

prina.definition: x_1 is a print/impression/image on/in surface x_2 of/made by/using tool/press/implement/object x_3.

pritu.definition: x_1 is to the right/right-hand side of x_2 which faces/in-frame-of-reference x_3.
pritu.note: Also: x_3 is the standard of orientation for x_2.  See also cmavo list {ri'u}, {mlana}, {crane}, {trixe}, {farna}, {zunle}.

prosa.definition: x_1 is prose about plot/theme/subject x_2 by author x_3 for intended audience x_4.
prosa.note: Non-poetic written text, without intentional rhyme or meter; x_2 may be a convention rather than a subject.  See also {cfika}, {lisri}, {cukta}, {pemci}, {finti}.

pruce.definition: x_1 is a process with inputs x_2, outputs/results x_3, passing through steps/stages x_4.
pruce.note: x_2 resource (= {selru'e}, but also {ru'etci}, (ru'er-/ruc- or selru'e-/selruc- modifying:) selxaksu, selsabji, livla).  See also cmavo list {pu'e}, {farvi}, {tadji}, {grute}, {tcini}.

pruxi.definition: x_1 is spiritual/pertains to the soul in nature [either energy or being]; x_1 is ghostly/ethereal.

pulce.definition: x_1 is dust/precipitate [suspensible solid] from x_2 in medium/on surface x_3.

pulji.definition: x_1 is a police officer/[enforcer/vigilante] enforcing law(s)/rule(s)/order x_2.
pulji.note: Police officer, as an agent of authority (= {ca'irpulji}, {ka'irpulji}), as part of a police force (= {puljysoi}, as part of {puljyselsoi}); military police (= {jempulji}, {bilpulji}).  See also {catni}, {sonci}, {bilni}, {flalu}, {bandu}, {jemna}, {zekri}, {krati}.

pulni.definition: x_1 is a pulley [tool] for performing action/function x_2 rotating on axle x_3.

punji.definition: x_1 (agent) puts/places/sets x_2 on/at surface/locus x_3.

punli.definition: x_1 is a swelling/protrusion/convexity [shape/form] at/in/on x_2, of material x_3.

purci.definition: x_1 is in the past of/earlier than/before x_2 in time sequence; x_1 is former; x_2 is latter.
purci.note: Time ordering only (use lidne otherwise); aorist in that x_1 may overlap in time with x_2 as long as it starts before, x_1 starts before x_2 but is continuing during x_2 (= {cfaprucabna}); non-aorist before, i.e. x_1 is over/ended before x_2 starts (= {fampru}), x_1 is completed before x_2 starts (= {mulpru}).  See also {lidne}, {balvi}, {cabna}, {farna}.

purdi.definition: x_1 is a garden/tended/cultivated field of family/community/farmer x_2 growing plants/crop x_3.

purmo.definition: x_1 is a powder of material x_2.

racli.definition: x_1 (action/activity/behavior) is sane/rational by standard x_2.

ractu.definition: x_1 is a rabbit/hare/[doe] of species/breed x_2.

radno.definition: x_1 is x_2 radian(s) [metric unit] in angular measure (default is 1) by standard x_3.
radno.note: Measured in degrees ({julra'o}); right ascension astronomical measurement. (= {cacryra'o}).  See also {jganu}, {kilto}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {gutci}, {litce}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {minli}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}.

rafsi.definition: x_1 is an affix/suffix/prefix/combining-form for word/concept x_2, form/properties x_3, language x_4.

ragve.definition: x_1 is located across/on the other side of gap/boundary x_2 from x_3; x_1 is opposite (fi) x_3.
ragve.note: Also: x_1 is over there (across/beyond zo'e); directly across/beyond a boundary/gap, generally at the shortest plausible distance on the other side of the boundary.  See also {dukti}, {kuspe}, {bancu}, {kruca}, {cripu}, {pagre}.

rakso.definition: x_1 reflects Iraqi culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

raktu.definition: x_1 (object/person/event/situation) troubles/disturbs x_2 (person) causing problem(s) x_3.
raktu.note: Also afflicts, is disruptive to, troublesome; x_1/x_3 are a care to x_2, x_2 is troubled by/cares about x_1/x_3 (= {selra'u} for reordered places).  See also {dicra}, {fanza}, {zunti}, {kurji}, {xanka}, {nabmi}.

ralci.definition: x_1 is delicate/fragile/subtle/refined in property x_2 (ka).
ralci.note: Easily damaged or rendered less pleasing/pure/effective.  See also {jdari}, {ranti}, {tsali}, {milxe}, {kukte}.

ralju.definition: x_1 is principal/chief/leader/main/[staple], most significant among x_2 (set) in property x_3 (ka).
ralju.note: Staple (= {ralselpra}); general/admiral/president/principal leader (= {ralja'a}, {ralterbe'e}; use additional terms to distinguish among these); also primary, prime, (adverb:) chiefly, principally, mainly; (x_2 is complete specification of set).  See also {vajni}, te {bende}, {minde}, {lidne}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {gidva}, {midju}.

ralte.definition: x_1 retains/keeps/holds x_2 in its possession.

randa.definition: x_1 yields/gives way/surrenders to x_2 (force/agent) under conditions x_3.

rango.definition: x_1 is a/the body organ [body-part] of body/species x_2 performing function x_3.

ranji.definition: x_1 (event/state) continues/persists over interval x_2; x_1 (property - ka) is continuous over x_2.

ranmi.definition: x_1 is a myth/legend, a culturally significant story about x_2 in mythos x_3 of culture x_4.
ranmi.note: Also: x_1 is mythical/fairy tale; used adjectivally for non-humanoid creatures (= {ramda'u}) of story/myth/legend/religion, e.g. dragon; fairy tale (= {veryranmi}).  See also {lijda}, {lisri}, {crida}.

ransu.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of bronze of composition including x_2.

ranti.definition: x_1 is soft/malleable/moldable/yielding to force x_2 in conditions x_3.

ranxi.definition: x_1 is ironic(al)/contrary to expectation x_2 in state/property/aspect x_3.

rapli.definition: x_1 [action] repeats/is repeated for a total of x_2 (quantity) occurrences.

rarna.definition: x_1 is natural/spontaneous/instinctive, not [consciously] caused by person(s).

ratcu.definition: x_1 is a rat of species/breed x_2.

ratni.definition: x_1 is an atom of element/atomic number x_2 of isotope number/atomic weight x_3.
ratni.note: (cf. {kantu} for a basic unit of a property or activity; {selci} for a basic physical subunit, generally of a mass)

rebla.definition: x_1 is a/the tail/appendix [body-part] of x_2; [metaphor: trailing, following portion/appendage].

rectu.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains meat/flesh from source/animal x_2.

remna.definition: x_1 is a human/human being/man (non-specific gender-free sense); (adjective:) x_1 is human.

renro.definition: x_1 throws/launches/casts/hurls x_2 to/at/in direction x_3 (propulsion derives internally to x_1).

renvi.definition: x_1 survives/endures/undergoes/abides/lasts/persists through x_2 for interval/duration x_3.
renvi.note: Also lasts out, withstands; x_1 persists/lasts for duration x_3; (adjective:) x_1 is tough/durable.  See also {ranji}, {kuspe}, {randa}, {lifri}, {stali}, {temci}.

respa.definition: x_1 is a reptile of species/breed x_2.

ricfu.definition: x_1 is rich/wealthy in goods/possessions/property/aspect x_2.

rigni.definition: x_1 is repugnant to/causes disgust to x_2 under conditions x_3.

rijno.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of silver/argentum (Ag); [metaphor: valuable, tarnishing].

rilti.definition: x_1 (sequence/non-text quote) is a rhythm/beat of music/expressive form x_2.
rilti.note: Not necessarily oscillatory/regular pattern.  See also {damri}, {pemci}, {tonga}, {zgike}, {slilu}, {dikni}, {sanga}, {morna}.

rimni.definition: x_1 rhymes/alliterates with x_2 in language/phonetics x_3, matching sound correspondence x_4 (ka).
rimni.note: Broad meaning of rhyme - any matching sound correspondence.  See also {pemci}, {sanga}.

rinci.definition: x_1 liquid/fluid drains/strains/flushes from source x_2 through drain/strainer x_3 by force x_4.
rinci.note: x_4 is usually gravity.  See also {pambe}, {tisna}, {setca}, {flecu}, {muvdu}, {ganxo}, {rirxe}.

rinju.definition: x_1 is restrained/held [back]/constrained/kept by restraint x_2 against x_3 (event).
rinju.note: Also: x_2 is a restraint/binding for x_1, x_2 keeps/restrains/holds [back]/constrains x_1 from x_3 (= {selri'u} for reordered places); agentive restraint (= {ri'urgau}, {ri'urzu'e}).  See also {zifre}, {ralte}, {pinfu}, {kavbu}, {fanta}, {jgari}, {jimte}, {bapli}, {curmi}, {kluza}, {tagji}.

rinka.definition: x_1 (event/state) effects/physically causes effect x_2 (event/state) under conditions x_3.
rinka.note: x_1 is a material condition for x_2; x_1 gives rise to x_2.  See also {gasnu}, {krinu}, {nibli}, te {zukte}, se {jalge}, {bapli}, {jitro}, cmavo list {ri'a}, {mukti}, {ciksi}, {xruti}.

rinsa.definition: x_1 (agent) greets/hails/[welcomes/says hello to]/responds to arrival of x_2 in manner x_3 (action).
rinsa.note: (cf. {friti} for welcome/hospitality, cmavo list {coi}, cmavo list {co'o})

rirci.definition: x_1 [member] is rare/unusual/uncommon/atypical in property x_2 (ka) among members of x_3 (set).
rirci.note: (x_3 is complete specification of set); (cf. {cizra}, {fadni}, {cafne}, {kampu}, {cnano} - the generalized opposite to any/all of these concepts)

rirni.definition: x_1 is a parent of/raises/rears x_2; x_1 mentors/acts parental toward child/protege x_2.

rirxe.definition: x_1 is a river of land mass x_2, draining watershed x_3 into x_4/terminating at x_4.

rismi.definition: x_1 is a quantity of rice [a type of grain] of strain/cultivar x_2.

risna.definition: x_1 is a/the heart [body-part] of x_2; [emotional/shape metaphors are NOT culturally neutral].
risna.note: (adjective:) x_1 is cardiac; emotional 'heart' (= {cnise'i}).  See also {pambe}, {ciblu}.

ritli.definition: x_1 is a rite/ceremony/ritual for purpose/goal x_2, by custom/in community x_3, with form/rules x_4.
ritli.note: [also: x_1 is formal, Legal.  x_1 is 'going through the motions']; x_4 constraints/customs; See also {lijda}, {malsi}, {flalu}, {javni}, {tcaci}, {clite}, {junri}.

rivbi.definition: x_1 avoids/evades/shuns/escapes/skirts [fate] x_2 (event) through action/state x_3 (event).
rivbi.note: Also detours around, stays away from; (x_1 is normally an object, but may be an event).  See also bandu which is not necessarily successful, {fanta}, which is agentive, se jersi which implies an opposing agent, {sisku}, {kalte}, {fapro}.

rokci.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains rock/stone of type/composition x_2 from location x_3.
rokci.note: x_2: composition including x_2, which need not be complete specification. See also {kunra}, {jemna}, {canre}.

romge.definition: x_1 is a highly reflective/polished non-tarnishing metallic surface, of metal x_2 [often chromium].

ropno.definition: x_1 reflects European culture/nationality/geography/Indo-European languages in aspect x_2.

rorci.definition: x_1 engenders/procreates/begets x_2 with coparent x_3.

rotsu.definition: x_1 is thick in dimension/direction x_2 by standard x_3; [relatively long in smallest dimension].

rozgu.definition: x_1 is a rose [flower - characterized by prickly stem/fragrance] of species/strain x_2.
rozgu.note: Roses are not all pink; avoid using for color rose, which might be {labyxu'e}.  See also {spati}, {xunre}.

ruble.definition: x_1 is weak/feeble/frail in property/quality/aspect x_2 (ka) by standard x_3.

runme.definition: x_1 melts [becomes liquid from solid state] at temperature x_2 and pressure x_3.

runta.definition: x_1 dissolves in solvent x_2 forming solution/[suspension] x_3 under conditions x_4.

rupnu.definition: x_1 is measured in major-money-units (dollar/yuan/ruble) as x_2 (quantity), monetary system x_3.
rupnu.note: Also pound, rupee, franc, mark, yen; x_1 is generally a price/cost/value.  See also {jdini}, {sicni}, {jdima}, {vecnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

rusko.definition: x_1 reflects Russian culture/nationality/language in aspect x_2.

rutni.definition: x_1 is an artifact; x_1 is artificial; x_1 is made/caused by people/se kulnu x_2; x_1 is man-made.

sabnu.definition: x_1 is a cabin of vehicle x_2.

sacki.definition: x_1 is a match [incendiary device] made of x_2.

saclu.definition: x_1 (me'o) is the [decimal/binary] equivalent of fractional x_2 (me'o) in base x_3 (quantity).
saclu.note: Conversion from fractions to decimal-point based notation. See also {namcu}, {frinu}.

sadjo.definition: x_1 reflects Saudi Arabian culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

sakci.definition: x_1 sucks/is suction/vacuum/relatively low pressure of fluid/gas x_2 relative to high pressure x_3.
sakci.note: Also suck object/fluid (= {sakcpu} or {sakmuvgau}).  See also {cokcu}, {lacpu}, {flecu}.

sakli.note: x_2 is slick/slippery to/for x_1 (= {selsakli} for reordered places).  See also {mosra}, {fulta}, {skiji}, {xutla}.

sakta.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of sugar [sweet edible] from source x_2 of composition x_3.
sakta.note: Also sucrose, fructose, glucose, galactose, lactose, etc.; saccharine/aspartame/sugar substitute ({basysakta} or {satybasti}, {ticysakta}); x_3: composition including x_3, which need not be complete specification.  See also {silna}, {titla}.

salci.definition: x_1 celebrates/recognizes/honors x_2 (event/abstract) with activity/[party] x_3.
salci.note: x_3 (and {nunsla}) festival/fiesta/celebration/occasion/fair/Holiday (some senses). Not limited to the ameliorative interpretation of 'celebrate': funeral (= {mrobixsla}).  See also {sinma}, {jbena}.

salpo.definition: x_1 is sloped/inclined/slanted/aslant with angle x_2 to horizon/frame x_3.
salpo.note: Also steep (= {tcesa'o}); normally implies non-rectilinear.  See also {kurfa}, {tutci}.

salta.definition: x_1 (mass) is a quantity of salad [food] with ingredients/components including x_2.
salta.note: x_2 is in x_1, an ingredient/part/component of x_1.  See also {mixre}, {stasu}.

samcu.definition: x_1 is a quantity of cassava/taro/manioc/tapioca/yam [edible starchy root] of species/strain x_2.

sampu.definition: x_1 is simple/unmixed/uncomplicated in property x_2 (ka).

sance.definition: x_1 is sound produced/emitted by x_2.

sanga.definition: x_1 sings/chants x_2 [song/hymn/melody/melodic sounds] to audience x_3.
sanga.note: Melody (= {sagzgi}, {ralsagzgi}), harmony (= {saxsagzgi}), harmonize/sing harmony (= {saxsa'a}), song (= {selsa'a}).  See also {pemci}, {rimni}, {rilti}, {siclu}.

sanji.definition: x_1 is conscious/aware of x_2 (object/abstract); x_1 discerns/recognizes x_2 (object/abstract).
sanji.note: [also: x_1 knows Of. x_2 (one sense); awareness implies some amount of mental processing above and beyond mere sensory detection, and may also be applied to mental relationships that are not detected by the senses]; See also {menli}, {morji}, {ganse}, {sipna}, {cikna}.

sanli.definition: x_1 stands [is vertically oriented] on surface x_2 supported by limbs/support/pedestal x_3.
sanli.note: x_1 is standing; x_1 stands up; x_1 is erect/vertical/upright; x_1 bows/bends over (= {krosa'i}, {krosa'ibi'o}, {plosa'i}); frame of reference is (approximate) perpendicularity to the surface, and not to a gravity field.  See also {kamju}, {sraji}, {tuple}, {zbepi}, {sarji}.

sanmi.definition: x_1 (mass) is a meal composed of dishes including x_2.
sanmi.note: x_2 is a course/dish of meal x_1 (= {selsai} for reordered places).  See also {barja}, {stasu}, {gusta}, {sanso}.

sanso.definition: x_1 is a sauce/topping/gravy/frosting for use with x_2, containing ingredient(s) including x_3.
sanso.note: x_3 is in x_1, an ingredient/part/component of sauce x_1.  See also {sanmi}, {mixre}, {stasu}.

santa.definition: x_1 is an umbrella/parasol shielding x_2 from x_3, made of material x_4, supported by x_5.

sarcu.definition: x_1 (abstract) is necessary/required for continuing state/process x_2 under conditions x_3.
sarcu.note: Also factually necessary, necessity, prerequisite, condition, precondition.  See also cmavo list {sau}, {nitcu}.

sarji.definition: x_1 supports/holds up/is underpinning of/[helps] x_2 against force/opposition x_3 with/by means x_4.
sarji.note: Also aids; (adjective:) x_1 is dependable, reliable (such reliability may be transient; this is not the usual sense of 'reliable' or 'dependable'); (x_2 is object/event).  See also {bradi}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {sidju}, {tugni}, {bongu}, {ckana}, {cpana}, {loldi}, {sanli}, {selfu}.

sarlu.definition: x_1 is a spiral/helix/whorl/[vortex] [shape/form] with limits x_2, of dimensionality x_3.

sarxe.definition: x_1 is harmonious/concordant/in agreement/concord with x_2 in property x_3 (ka).

saske.definition: x_1 (mass of facts) is science of/about subject matter x_2 based on methodology x_3.
saske.note: Not limited to science as derived by the scientific method, but pertaining to any body of usually-coherent knowledge garnered/gathered/assembled by a consistent methodology.  See also {datni}, {fatci}, {djuno}, {cipra}, {pensi}, {jimpe}.

satci.definition: x_1 [measurement/match] is exact/precise to precision x_2 in property/quantity x_3 (ka/ni).

savru.definition: x_1 is a noise/din/clamor [sensory input without useful information] to x_2 via sensory channel x_3.

sazri.definition: x_1 operates/drives/runs x_2 [apparatus/machine] with goal/objective/use/end/function x_3.

sefta.definition: x_1 is surface/face [bounded shape/form] of [higher-dimension] object x_2, on side x_3, edges x_4.

selci.definition: x_1 is a cell/atom/unit/molecule of x_2; x_1 is an indivisible, most basic subunit of x_2.
selci.note: (x_2 generally has mass nature); (cf. {kantu} for properties, activities; {ratni}, {gradu})

selfu.definition: x_1 (agent) serves x_2 with service x_3 (activity); x_1 is a servant (noun) of x_2 performing x_3.

semto.definition: x_1 reflects Semitic [metaphor: Middle-Eastern] language/culture/nationality in aspect x_2.
semto.note: Semitic includes Arabic, Hebrew, Aramaic, and Ethiopian, among others.  See also {xrabo}.

senpi.definition: x_1 doubts/is dubious/doubtful/skeptical/questions that x_2 (du'u) is true.
senpi.note: Also: x_2 is doubtful/dubious/questionable (= {selsenpi} for reordered places).  See also {jinvi}, {krici}, {djuno}, {birti}.

senta.definition: x_1 is a layer/stratum [shape/form] of x_2 [material] within structure/continuum/composite x_3.

senva.definition: x_1 dreams about/that x_2 (fact/idea/event/state); x_2 is a dream/reverie of x_1.

sepli.definition: x_1 is apart/separate from x_2, separated by partition/wall/gap/interval/separating medium x_3.
sepli.note: Also aloof (= {jiksei}); alone (= {rolsmisei} meaning apart or unlike all others of its kind; {pavysei}, {seirpavmei} meaning "only" or "one alone" - do not use when talking about, for example, two people who are alone); x_3 space.  See also {bitmu}, {snuji}, {senta}, {fendi}, {curve}, {jinsa}, {bitmu}, {marbi}.

serti.definition: x_1 are stairs/stairway/steps for climbing structure x_2 with steps x_3.

setca.definition: x_1 (agent) inserts/interposes/puts/deposits x_2 into interior x_3/into among/between members of x_3.
setca.note: Insertion need not imply a significant degree of 'filling'; inject (= {je'erse'a}); syringe/needle (= {se'arterje'e}, {je'erse'atci}, {jestu'u} or {tu'urjesni}); also pour, inflate, stuff, fill.  See also {rinci}, {tisna}, {punji}, {jbini}, {nenri}, {jmina}, {culno}, {kunti}, {catlu}.

sevzi.definition: x_1 is a self/ego/id/identity-image of x_2.

sfani.definition: x_1 is a fly [a small non-stinging flying insect] of species/breed x_2.

sfasa.definition: x_1 (agent) punishes x_2 for infraction x_3 (event/state/action) with punishment x_4 (event/state).
sfasa.note: Also chastise, castigate, chasten, discipline, correct (one sense); also x_4 penalty.  See also {cnemu}, {pleji}, {venfu}, {zekri}, {canja}, {dunda}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}, {prali}, {dapma}, {cirko}, {jinga}.

sfubu.definition: x_1 dives/swoops [manner of controlled falling] to x_2 from x_3.

siclu.definition: x_1 [sound source] whistles/makes whistling sound/note/tone/melody x_2.

sicni.definition: x_1 is a coin/token/is specie issued by x_2 having value x_3 of composition including x_4.

sidbo.definition: x_1 (idea abstract) is an idea/concept/thought about x_2 (object/abstract) by thinker x_3.
sidbo.note: Also (adjective:) x_1 is ideal/ideational.  See also {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {mucti}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {xanri}, cmavo list {si'o}.

sidju.definition: x_1 helps/assists/aids object/person x_2 do/achieve/maintain event/activity x_3.

sigja.definition: x_1 is a cigar/cigarette/cigarillo made from tobacco/smokable substance x_2 by x_3.

silka.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of silk produced by x_2.

silna.definition: x_1 is a portion/quantity of salt from source x_2, of composition including x_3.

simlu.definition: x_1 seems/appears to have property(ies) x_2 to observer x_3 under conditions x_4.
simlu.note: Also: x_1 seems like it has x_2 to x_3; suggest belief/observation (= {mlugau}, {mluti'i}); looks like/resembles (= {smimlu}, {mitmlu}).  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {simsa}, {zgana}, {ganse}, {jarco}.

simsa.definition: x_1 is similar/parallel to x_2 in property/quantity x_3 (ka/ni); x_1 looks/appears like x_2.
simsa.note: Also: x_1 is a likeness/image of x_2; x_1 and x_2 are alike; similarity and parallel differ primarily in emphasis.  See also {dunli}, {frica}, {mintu}, {panra}, {simlu}, {vrici}.

simxu.definition: x_1 (set) has members who mutually/reciprocally x_2 (event [x_1 should be reflexive in 1+ sumti]).
simxu.note: Members of x_1 do to each other/one another x_2, and in return do x_2; x_1 (plural set) do the same thing x_2 to each other.  See also {kampu}, {mintu}.

since.definition: x_1 is a snake/serpent of species/breed x_2.

sinma.definition: x_1 esteems/respects/venerates/highly regards x_2 [object of respect].
sinma.note: Also: x_2 is respected/esteemed/celebrated (= {selsi'a} for reordered places).  See also {banli}, {censa}, {misno}, {nelci}, {prami}, {salci}, {jgira}.

sinso.definition: x_1 is the trigonometric sine of angle/arcsine x_2.

sinxa.definition: x_1 is a sign/symbol/signal representing/referring/signifying/meaning x_2 to observer x_3.
sinxa.note: Also: x_1 signifies x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is significant/meaningful/of import; signal an action (= {sniti'i}), connotation (= se {sibyti'isni}, {sibyti'ismu}).  See also {lerfu}, {tcita}, {barna}, {mifra}, {smuni}.

sipna.definition: x_1 is asleep (adjective); x_1 sleeps/is sleeping.

sirji.definition: x_1 is straight/direct/line segment/interval between x_2 and x_3; (adjective:)  x_1 is linear.

sirxo.definition: x_1 reflects Syrian culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

sisku.definition: x_1 seeks/searches/looks for property x_2 among set x_3 (complete specification of set).
sisku.note: If searching for an object or an event, use tu'a in x_2.  See also {cirko}, {kalte}, {kavbu}, {kucli}, {rivbi}, {manci}, {facki}.

sisti.definition: x_1 [agent] ceases/stops/halts/ends activity/process/state x_2 [not necessarily completing it].

sitna.definition: x_1 cites/quotes/refers to/makes reference to source x_2 for information/statement x_3 (du'u).

sivni.definition: x_1 is private/personal/privy/[secret/confidential/confined] to x_2; x_1 is not-public/hidden.
sivni.note: Also: x_1 is secret (one sense); x_2 is in the know/in touch with/privy to x_1 (= {selsivni} for reordered places); exclusion can be expressed by na'e(bo) in x_2: excluded/in the dark (= {nalselsivni}).  See also {gubni}, {mipri}.

skaci.definition: x_1 is a skirt/kilt/dress of material x_2; x_1 is skirted [garment open at the bottom; not legged].
skaci.note: A skirted garment may be full length ({pastu}), but must hang below the waist from support above or at the waist.  See also {taxfu}, {palku}.

skami.definition: x_1 is a computer for purpose x_2.

skapi.definition: x_1 is a pelt/skin/hide/leather from x_2.

skari.definition: x_1 is/appears to be of color/hue x_2 as perceived/seen by x_3 under conditions x_4.
skari.note: Conditions may include lighting, background, etc..  See also {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {cinta}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xunre}, {zirpu}, {carmi}, {kandi}, {xekri}, {blabi}.

skicu.definition: x_1 tells about/describes x_2 (object/event/state) to audience x_3 with description x_4 (property).

skiji.definition: x_1 is a ski/skid/skate/runner for surface (of material) x_2 supporting skier/skater/sled/cargo x_3.

skina.definition: x_1 is a cinema/movie/film about x_2 [plot/theme/subject/activity], filmmaker x_3, for audience x_4.
skina.note: Also motion picture; x_2 may be a convention rather than a subject; cartoon/animation (= selxraci'a {skina}); television/tv show (= {tivyskina}, regardless of length, factual content, etc.).  See also {tivni}, {vidni}, {pixra}, {finti}.

skori.definition: x_1 is cord/cable/rope/line/twine/cordage/woven strands of material x_2.

skoto.definition: x_1 reflects Gaelic/Scottish culture/nationality/language in aspect x_2.
skoto.note: Irish (= {sicko'o}), Scottish (= {sunko'o}), Celtic (= {dzeko'o}), Welsh (= {nanko'o}), Breton (= {fasko'o}); since Scottish/Gaelic is only the northern branch of the Celtic tribes, many would prefer a fu'ivla for Celtic; nationalism might also demand a separate fu'ivla for Irish.  See also {brito}, {glico}.

skuro.definition: x_1 is a groove/trench/furrow [shape/form] in object/surface x_2.

slabu.definition: x_1 is old/familiar/well-known to observer x_2 in feature x_3 (ka) by standard x_4.
slabu.note: This can cover both meanings of old.  Old in years, i.e. age, can be conveyed through x_2 = the world, life, existence (= loi nu {zasti}); in usage this has been a common default for ellipsis.  However slabu is not the opposite of 'young' (= {nalci'o}, {tolci'o}), but the opposite of 'new' (= {tolni'o}); also ancient (= {tcesau}), age (= {nilsau}); x_2 is used to x_1 (= selsau for reordered places); historic/historical (= {cirsau}, {cirselcedra}; also {vaipru}).  (cf. {clani}, {citno}, {cnino}, se {djuno}; not the opposite of {citno}, {djuno})

slaka.definition: x_1 is a syllable in language x_2.

slami.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of acid of composition x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is acidic.
slami.note: x_2: composition including x_2, which need not be complete specification.  See also {slari}, {nimre}.

slanu.definition: x_1 is a cylinder [shape/form] of material x_2.

slari.definition: x_1 is sour/tart to observer x_2.

slasi.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains plastic/polymer of type/component unit(s) x_2.

sligu.definition: x_1 is solid, of composition/material including x_2, under conditions x_3.
sligu.note: Conditions include temperature and pressure.  See also {runta}, {litki}, {gapci}, {jdari}, {dunja}, {pulce}, {jduli}.

slilu.definition: x_1 oscillates at rate/frequency x_2 through set/sequence-of-states x_3 (complete specification).
slilu.note: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and from, back and forth, reciprocal (motion), rotates, revolves.  See also {dikni}, {rilti}, {morna}, {desku}, {janbe}, {boxna}.

sliri.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of sulfur/brimstone (S); [metaphor: foul odor, volcanic].

slovo.definition: x_1 reflects Slavic language/culture/ethos in aspect x_2.

sluji.definition: x_1 is a/the muscle [body-part] controlling x_2, of body x_3; [metaphor: tools of physical power].
sluji.note: (adjective:) x_1/x_2/x_3 is muscular (different senses).  See also {rectu}, {xadni}, {zajba}.

sluni.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains onions/scallions of type/cultivar x_2.

smacu.definition: x_1 is a mouse of species/breed x_2.

smadi.definition: x_1 guesses/conjectures/surmises x_2 (du'u) is true about subject x_3; [epistemology].
smadi.note: Also: x_1 has a hunch that x_2 is true; x_1 imagines x_2 is true; words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jijnu}, {sruma}.

smaji.definition: x_1 (source) is quiet/silent/[still] at observation point x_2 by standard x_3.

smani.definition: x_1 is a monkey/ape/simian/baboon/chimpanzee of species/breed x_2.

smoka.definition: x_1 is a sock/stocking [flexible foot and lower leg garment] of material x_2.

smuci.definition: x_1 is a spoon/scoop (tool) for use x_2, made of material x_3.

smuni.definition: x_1 is a meaning/interpretation of x_2 recognized/seen/accepted by x_3.

snada.definition: x_1 [agent] succeeds in/achieves/completes/accomplishes x_2 as a result of effort/attempt/try x_3.
snada.note: Also: x_1 reaches x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is successful; x_2 (event/state/achievement).  See also {fliba}, {troci}, {jgira}.

snanu.definition: x_1 is to the south/southern side of x_2 according to frame of reference x_3.

snidu.definition: x_1 is x_2 seconds in duration (default is 1 second) by standard x_3.

snime.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of snow.

snipa.definition: x_1 adheres/sticks to x_2; (adjective:) x_1 is sticky/gummy/adhesive.
snipa.note: Note that x_1 is the adhering surface being claimed; x_2 need not be sticky.  See also {tarla}, {viknu}.

snuji.definition: x_1 is a sandwich/layering [not restricted to food] of x_2 sandwiched between x_3.

snura.definition: x_1 is secure/safe from threat x_2 (event).

snuti.definition: x_1 (event/state) is an accident/unintentional on the part of x_2; x_1 is an accident.

sobde.definition: x_1 is a quantity of soya [grain/bean] of species/strain x_2.

sodna.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali metal of type x_2 [default sodium].
sodna.note: Also potassium, lithium, cesium.  Soda. See also {jilka}, {jinme}.

sodva.definition: x_1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of a carbonated beverage/soda of flavor/brand x_2.
sodva.note: Also: soft drink (though this sometimes includes tea and coffee as distinct from alcoholic beverages which are "hard drinks").  See also {jilka}, {jinme}.

softo.definition: x_1 reflects Russian empire/USSR/ex-USSR (Soviet]/CIS culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

solji.definition: x_1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of gold (Au); [metaphor: valuable, heavy, non-reactive].

solri.definition: x_1 is the sun of home planet x_2 (default Earth) of race x_3; (adjective:) x_1 is solar.
solri.note: home planet' refers to a planet which is "home" to a race, but not necessarily the original "home" of a species if that species inhabits many worlds.  See also {gusni}, {lunra}, {mluni}, {plini}, {santa}, {terdi}, {tarci}.

sonci.definition: x_1 is a soldier/warrior/fighter of army x_2.

sorcu.definition: x_1 is a store/deposit/supply/reserve of materials/energy x_2 in containment x_3.
sorcu.note: x_3 need not be a container, but could merely be a site/location restriction; e.g. a heap.  The sumti indicates how the supply is identified and distinguished from other occurrences of the stored x_2 that are not part of the store.  (cf. {panka}; {vreji} for information storage; {sabji} for a store or reserve that is not necessarily tied to a site, {banxa}, {panka})

sorgu.definition: x_1 is a quantity of sorghum of species/strain x_2.

sovda.definition: x_1 is an egg/ovum/sperm/pollen/gamete of/from organism [mother/father] x_2.
sovda.note: (poorly metaphorical only due to gender- and species- being unspecified): ovoid, oblate (= {pevyso'aseltai}, but better: {claboi}); egg, specifically female (= {fetso'a}), of a bird (= {cpifetso'a}, {cpiso'a}), of a chicken (= {jipcyfetso'a}, {jipcyso'a}. (but note that Lojban does not require specificity, just as English doesn't for either milk or eggs; "sovda" is fine for most contexts); If fertilized, then {tsiju} or {tarbi}.  (cf. {ganti}, {gutra}, {mamta}, {patfu}, {rorci}, {tsiju}, {lanbi}, {tarbi}; also {djine}, {konju} for shape, {tarbi})

spaji.definition: x_1 (event/action abstract) surprises/startles/is unexpected [and generally sudden] to x_2.

spali.definition: x_1 (agent) polishes object/surface x_2 with polish x_3, applied using tool x_4.

spano.definition: x_1 reflects Spanish-speaking culture/nationality/language in aspect x_2.
spano.note: Metaphorical restriction to Spain by contrast with xispo (comparable to the distinction between glico and merko/sralo/brito/kadno); Spain (= {sangu'e}); Spanish dialects spoken in Spain, especially Castillian (= {sansanbau}).  See also {xispo}, {ketco}, {mexno}, {gento}.

spati.definition: x_1 is a plant/herb/greenery of species/strain/cultivar x_2.
spati.note: Also (adjective:) x_1 is vegetable/vegetal/vegetative.  See also {genja}, {grute}, {gurni}, {latna}, {rozgu}, {stagi}, {tricu}, {tsiju}, {tujli}, {xruba}, {xrula}, {pezli}, {srasu}.

speni.definition: x_1 is married to x_2; x_1 is a spouse of x_2 under law/custom/tradition/system/convention x_3.

spisa.definition: x_1 [object/substance] is a piece/portion/lump/chunk/particle of x_2 [substance].

spita.definition: x_1 is a hospital treating patient(s) x_2 for condition/injuries/disease/illness x_3.
spita.note: Hospice (a place where x_2 of spita is lenu {mrobi'o} = {mrospita}).  See also {bilma}, {mikce}.

spofu.definition: x_1 is broken/inoperable/broken down/non-utile/not usable for function x_2.
spofu.note: Agentive break, cause to become inoperable (= {pofygau}, {pofyzu'e}); accidentally break, as a result of an event, non-agentive (= {pofyja'e}, {nutpo'uja'e}).  See also {daspo}, {katna}, {porpi}, {se} {xrani}, {cikre}.

spoja.definition: x_1 bursts/explodes/violently breaks up/decomposes/combusts into pieces/energy/fragments x_2.

spuda.definition: x_1 answers/replies to/responds to person/object/event/situation/stimulus x_2 with response x_3.
spuda.note: x_3 also answer/reply.  If x_2 is a person/object, it will usually require "tu'a" indicating that the reply/response is to that person/object doing something.  "tu'a" may not be needed if the person/object itself is the stimulus, rather than something it is doing. See also {cusku}, {preti}, {nabmi}, {danfu}, {frati}, {cpedu}.

sputu.definition: x_1 spits/expectorates x_2 [predominantly liquid] from x_3 to/onto x_4.

sraji.definition: x_1 is vertical/upright/erect/plumb/oriented straight up and down in reference frame/gravity x_2.

sraku.note: (cf. {guska}, {katna}, {mosra}, {plixa}, {kakpa} (unlike kakpa, sraku does not imply material is removed), {spali})

sralo.definition: x_1 reflects Australian culture/nationality/geography/dialect in aspect x_2.

srana.definition: x_1 pertains to/is germane/relevant to/concerns/is related/associated with/is about x_2.
srana.note: Also: x_1 is a question of/treats of x_2; can be symmetric, although x_1 is conventionally more specific or constrained in scope than x_2.  See also cmavo list {ra'a}, {ckini}, {ponse}, {steci}.

srasu.definition: x_1 is a blade/expanse of grass of species x_2.

srera.definition: x_1 errs in doing/being/making mistake x_2 (event), an error under conditions x_3 by standard x_4.

srito.definition: x_1 reflects Sanskrit language/Sanskritic/Vedic culture/nationality in aspect x_2.

sruma.definition: x_1 assumes/supposes that x_2 (du'u) is true about subject x_3; [epistemology].
sruma.note: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {smadi}, {birti}.

sruri.definition: x_1 encircles/encloses/is surrounding x_2 in direction(s)/dimension(s)/plane x_3.
sruri.note: ({jinsru} =) x_1 is a ring/belt/band/girdle around/circling/ringing x_2 near total containment in some dimension(s).  See also {karli}, {senta}, {snuji}, {vanbi}, se {nenri}, se {jbini}, {bartu}, {djine}.

stace.definition: x_1 is honest/open/truthfully revealing to/candid/frank with x_2 about matter/fact x_3.
